original: etat ṣaḍguṇitaṃ yantraṃ sarvasiddhikaraṃ param // //
analyzed: etat ṣaṣ guṇitam yantram sarva siddhi karam param
translated: This yantra, having six parts, is supreme in bestowing all accomplishments.

original: atra devīṃ yajenmaṃtrī yadyasyopariśobhanam /
analyzed: atra devīm yajet maṃtrī yat yasya upari śobhanam
translated: Here, the worshipper should worship the Goddess, if it is an ornament above him.

original: padmaṃ dvādaśapatraṃ ca ṣaḍviṃśatkesarānvitam // //
analyzed: padmam dvādaśa patram ca ṣaḍviṃśat kesara anvitam
translated: A lotus with twelve petals and twenty-six filaments,

original: bahiśca rāśyādikena yuktaṃ kuryānmanoharam /
analyzed: bahis ca rāśi ādikena yuktam kuryāt manoharam
translated: And outside, he should make it charming with the signs of the zodiac etc.

original: navaśaktiyutaṃ pīṭhaṃ saṃpūjyāvāhya devatām // //
analyzed: nava śakti yutam pīṭham saṃpūjya āvāhya devatām
translated: Having invoked the deity, he should worship the seat endowed with nine powers,

original: saṃpūjayet candanādairupacāraiśca pūrvavat /
analyzed: saṃpūjayet candana ādaiḥ upacāraiḥ ca pūrvavat
translated: And worship with sandalwood paste and other offerings as before.

original: proktavacca ṣaḍaṅgāni mithunāni ca saṃyajet // //
analyzed: prokta vat ca ṣaṣ aṅgāni mithunāni ca saṃyajet
translated: And he should worship the six limbs and the pairs as mentioned before,

original: bahirdvādaśaśaktīśca raktādyāḥ saṃyajet kramāt /
analyzed: bahis dvādaśa śaktīḥ ca rakta ādyāḥ saṃyajet kramāt
translated: And outside, he should worship the twelve powers beginning with Rakta in order.

original: raktā cānaṅgakusumā nityā ca kusumāturā // //
analyzed: raktā ca anaṅgakusumā nityā ca kusumāturā
translated: Rakta, Anangakusuma, Nitya, Kusumatura,

original: anaṅgamadanā tadvad bhavecca madanāturā /
analyzed: anaṅgamadanā tadvat bhavet ca madana āturā
translated: Anangamana, and likewise Madanatura,

original: gaurī ca gaganā tadvad rekhāntaṃ gaganaṃ padam // //
analyzed: gaurī ca gaganā tadvat rekhā antam gaganam padam
translated: Gauri, Gagana, and likewise the state of the end of the line, the state of the sky,

original: anena vidhinā maṃtrī yo'rcayedbhuvaneśvarīm /
analyzed: anena vidhinā maṃtrī yaḥ urcayet bhuvaneśvarīm
translated: By this method, the worshipper who worships Bhuvaneshvari,

analyzed: sa lakṣmī nilayaḥ bhūyāt tridaśaiḥ ca abhivanditaḥ
translated: He will become the abode of Lakshmi and will be revered by the gods.

original: dehānte śivasāyujyaṃ sa prāpnoti suniścitam /
analyzed: dehānte śiva sāyujyam sa prāpnoti su niścitam
translated: At the end of the body, he will certainly attain union with Shiva.

original: iti siṃhasiddhāntasindhau viśeṣaḥ // // // asyārthaḥ tatra
analyzed: iti siṃhasiddhāntasindhau viśeṣaḥ    asya arthaḥ tatra
translated: Thus ends the special section in the ocean of the final conclusions of the lion. The meaning of this is as follows:

original: sveṣṭamānabhrameṇa vṛttaṃ kṛtvā tatra prāk pratyagbrahmasūtramāsphālya
analyzed: sva iṣṭa māna bhrameṇa vṛttam kṛtvā tatra prāk pratyak brahmasūtram āsphālya
translated: Having drawn a circle according to one's desired size, and having extended the Brahma thread in the east-west direction there,

original: tadagrayoḥ sandhimavaṣṭabhya vṛttārdhaparimāṇena sūtreṇa vṛttasaṃdaṣṭaṃ🔽matsyadvayaṃ matsyadvayaṃ dakṣinottarayoḥ kuryāt / evaṃkṛte matsyacatuṣkaṃ
analyzed: tad agrayoḥ sandhim avaṣṭabhya vṛtta ardha parimāṇena sūtreṇa vṛtta saṃdaṣṭam  matsya dvayam matsya dvayam dakṣinā uttarayoḥ kuryāt evaṃkṛte matsya catuṣkam
translated: having fixed the junction at its tip, one should make two fish cut by the thread measuring half the circle,🔽in the south and north. When this is done, a set of four fish is accomplished.

original: saṃpannaṃ bhavati tataḥ pūrvamatsyadvaye ca dakṣiṇottaraṃ
analyzed: saṃpannam bhavati tatas pūrva matsya dvaye ca dakṣiṇa uttaram
translated: Then, in the pair of eastern fish, having extended two horizontal threads in the south and north,

original: tiryaksūtradvayamāsphālya brahmasūtrasya prāgagre vidhāya🔽paścimamatsyadvayayostiryaksūtradvayamāsphālya punarbrahmasūtrasya🔽paścimāgre nidhāya pūrvadiṅmatsyodarayoḥ sūtradvayamāsphālayet / evaṃ
analyzed: tiryak sūtra dvayam āsphālya brahmasūtrasya prāc agre vidhāya  paścima matsya dvayayoḥ tiryak sūtra dvayam āsphālya punar brahmasūtrasya  paścima agre nidhāya pūrva diś matsya udarayoḥ sūtra dvayam āsphālayet evam
translated: and having placed them at the eastern tip of the Brahma thread,🔽having extended two horizontal threads in the pair of western fish, and having placed them again at the western tip of the Brahma thread,🔽one should extend two threads in the belly of the eastern fish. When this is done,

original: kṛte vahnimaṇḍaladvayaṃ jāyate tato vṛttaṃ prācīsūtraṃ ca mārjayedityevaṃ
analyzed: kṛte vahni maṇḍala dvayam jāyate tatas vṛttam prācī sūtram ca mārjayet iti evam
translated: two fire mandalas are produced. Then one should erase the circle and the east thread. Thus

original: ṣaṭkoṇaṃ kṛtvā tanmadhye śaktibījamālikhya tasya rephabhāge
analyzed: ṣaṭkoṇam kṛtvā tad madhye śakti bījam ālikhya tasya repha bhāge
translated: having drawn a hexagon, having written the seed of Shakti in its center,🔽having written the name of the person to be accomplished in the part of the letter ra,

original: sādhyanāmālikhya tasyekārasvarabhāge sādhakanāmālikhya
analyzed: sādhya nāma ālikhya tasya ikāra svara bhāge sādhaka nāma ālikhya
translated: and having written the name of the performer in the part of the vowel i,

original: rephekārayorantarālaṃ sādhakāṃśe karma likhedityevaṃ svābhimataṃ vilikhya
analyzed: repha ikārayoḥ antarālam sādhaka aṃśe karma likhet iti evam sva abhimatam vilikhya
translated: The space between the letters re and ka in the mantra portion should be written with the name of the practitioner. Having written this,

original: madhyasthabījoparito veṣṭanaprakāreṇa pañcadhāśaktibījaṃ vilikhya tadbahiḥ
translated: above the seed syllable in the center, the five seed syllables of Shakti should be written in the form of an encircling. Outside that,

original: pañcadhā śrībījaṃ punastadbahiḥ pañcadhā kāmabījaṃ vilikhya
analyzed: pañcadhā śrībījam punar tad bahis pañcadhā kāmabījam vilikhya
translated: the Shri bija should be written five times. Outside that, the Kama bija should be written five times.

original: ṣaṭkoṇasyodhrvagatakoṇatraye uttaramadhyadakṣiṇakrameṇa śaktiśrīkāmabījāni
analyzed: ṣaṭkoṇasya ūdhrva gata koṇa traye uttara madhya dakṣiṇa krameṇa śakti śrī kāma bījāni
translated: In the three corners above the six-sided figure, the Shakti, Shri, and Kama bijas should be written in the order of north, middle, and south.

original: pratitrikoṇamekaikaṃ bījaṃ sādhakanāmayutaṃ vilikhyādhogatatrikoṇatraye
analyzed: pratitrikoṇam ekaikam bījam sādhaka nāma yutam vilikhya adhas gata trikoṇa traye
translated: In each triangle, each bija should be written along with the name of the practitioner. In the three triangles below,

original: tānyeva bījāni visargayuktāni sasādhyanāmāni dakṣiṇamadhyottarakrameṇa
analyzed: tāni eva bījāni visarga yuktāni sa sādhya nāmāni dakṣiṇa madhya uttara krameṇa
translated: those same bijas should be written along with the name of the person to be accomplished, along with visarga, in the order of south, middle, and north.

original: vilikhya ṣaṭsvapi trikoṇodareṣu sabinduṃ caturthasvaramīkāramālikhya ṣaṭkoṇasya
analyzed: vilikhya ṣaṭsu api trikoṇa udareṣu sa bindum caturtha svaram īkāram ālikhya ṣaṭkoṇasya
translated: In the six triangles, the fourth vowel i with a bindu should be written. In each corner of the six-sided figure,

original: pratikoṇapārśvayoḥ harihara iti dvādaśadhā vilikhya ṣaṭsu trikoṇāgreṣu
analyzed: pratikoṇa pārśvayoḥ hariharaḥ iti dvādaśadhā vilikhya ṣaṭsu trikoṇa agreṣu
translated: Hari Hari should be written twelve times. In the six tips of the triangles,

original: pratitrikoṇāgramekamekaṃ śaktibījaṃ vilikhya pūrvavadekaikāntaritaṃ badhnīyāt
analyzed: prati tri koṇa agram ekam ekam śakti bījam vilikhya pūrvavat ekaika antaritam badhnīyāt
translated: each tip should be written with one of the Shakti bijas. As before, they should be connected with one letter in between.

original: uktaṃ cācāryacaraṇaiḥ ekaikāntaritāstāstu sambaddhyuritaretaramiti tato
analyzed: uktam ca ācārya caraṇaiḥ ekaika antaritāḥ tāḥ tu sambaddhyuḥ itaretaram iti
translated: And it has been said by the venerable teachers: Let them be separated by one space each, and be connected with each other. Then,

original: bahirvṛttatrayaṃ kṛtvā vīthīdvayaṃ niṣpādya tatrābhyantaravīthyāṃ svāgrādi🔽prādakṣiṇyena sabindūnakārādikṣakārāntān mātṛkāvarṇān vilikhya
analyzed: bahis vṛtta trayam kṛtvā vīthī dvayam niṣpādya tatra abhyantara vīthyām sva agra ādi  prādakṣiṇyena sa bindū nakāra ādi kṣakāra antān mātṛkā varṇān vilikhya
translated: having made three outer circles and produced two paths, having written the vowels of the alphabet with bindus, starting from one's own front🔽in a clockwise direction, from the letter a up to the letter kṣa on the inner path,

original: bahirvīthyāṃ tāneva kṣakārādyakārāntakrameṇa prādakṣiṇyena vilikhet uktaṃ ca
analyzed: bahis vīthyām tān eva kṣakāra ādi akāra anta krameṇa prādakṣiṇyena vilikhet uktam ca
translated: and having written those same [vowels] in a counter-clockwise direction, from the letter kṣa up to the letter a on the outer path, and it has been said

original: ācāryacaraṇaiḥ
analyzed: ācārya caraṇaiḥ
translated: by the venerable teachers:

original: bāhye rekhāmantarāḥ syurvarṇāḥ kramagatāḥ śubhāḥ /
analyzed: bāhye rekhā mantarāḥ syuḥ varṇāḥ krama gatāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: The auspicious letters should be in order, inside the outer line.

original: tadbahiḥ pratilomāśca te syurlekhakapāṭavāt // iti
analyzed: tad bahis pratilomāḥ ca te syuḥ lekhaka pāṭavāt iti
translated: Outside of that, they should be in the reverse order, due to the skill of the writer.

original: tato bahiraṣṭakoṇaṃ vidhāya tasya diggatakrameṇa catuṣke vakṣyamāṇaṃ🔽nṛsiṃhabījaṃ vilikhya vidiggate koṇacatuṣke vakṣyamāṇaṃ cintāmaṇibījaṃ
analyzed: tatas bahis aṣṭa koṇam vidhāya tasya diś gata krameṇa catuṣke vakṣyamāṇam  nṛsiṃha bījam vilikhya vidiś gate koṇa catuṣke vakṣyamāṇam cintāmaṇi bījam

original: vilikhyāṣṭakoṇastharekhāṣṭakaprāntaṣoḍaśake ṣoḍaśatriśūlāni kuryāt
analyzed: vilikhya aṣṭa koṇa stha rekhā aṣṭaka prānta ṣoḍaśake ṣoḍaśa triśūlāni kuryāt
translated: and having written the seed syllable of the wish-fulfilling gem, which will be mentioned, in the four corners in the intermediate directions, one should make sixteen tridents on the sixteen ends of the eight lines in the eight corners.

original: uktañcācāryacaraṇaiḥ
analyzed: uktam ca ācārya caraṇaiḥ
translated: And it has been said by the venerable teachers:

original: bahiḥ ṣoḍaśaśūlāṅkaṃ śobhanaṃ vyaktavarṇavat iti
analyzed: bahis ṣoḍaśa śūla aṅkam śobhanam vyakta varṇavat iti
translated: Outside, adorned with sixteen tridents, with clear letters.

original: etat ṣaḍguṇitaṃ yantramuktaphaladaṃ bhavati // siṃ siṃ patra
analyzed: etat ṣaṣ guṇitam yantram ukta phala dam bhavati siṃ siṃ patra
translated: Siṃ Siṃ patra

original: p / 🔽bījaṃ vyāhṛtibhiryutaṃ vṛtaṃ gṛhayugadvandve vasoḥ koṇagaṃ
analyzed: p  bījam vyāhṛtibhiḥ yutam vṛtam gṛha yuga dvandve vasoḥ koṇa gam
translated: P.🔽The seed syllable along with the Vyāhṛtis, surrounded by the two pairs of Gṛhas, with Vasa in the corners,

original: daurgaṃ bījamanantare lipiyutairābaddhagaṇḍaṃ likhet /
analyzed: daurgam bījam anantare lipi yutaiḥ ābaddha gaṇḍam likhet
translated: The seed syllable along with the Vyāhṛtis, surrounded by the two pairs of Gṛha, with the seed syllable of Durgā in the corners, should be written with the letters of the next row, with the cheeks joined.

original: gāyatryā raviśaktibaddhavivaraṃ triṣṭubyutaṃ tat tato
analyzed: gāyatryā ravi śakti baddha vivaram triṣṭubh yutam tat
translated: Then, the seed syllable with the gap enclosed by the Gāyatrī and the power of the sun, along with the Triṣṭubh meter,

original: bījaṃ mātṛkayā dharāpurayuge satsiṃhacintāmaṇiḥ // //
analyzed: bījam mātṛkayā dharā pura yuge sat siṃha cintāmaṇiḥ
translated: and with the Mātṛkā and the two syllables of the earth and the city, is the excellent Lion's Wish-Fulfilling Gem.

original: yaṃtraṃ dineśaguṇitaṃ proktai rakṣāprasiddhidam /
analyzed: yaṃtram dineśa guṇitam proktaiḥ rakṣā prasiddhi dam
translated: The yantra, multiplied by the qualities of the sun, gives the accomplishment of protection as stated.🔽It generates all good fortune and wards off all enemies.

original: sarvasaubhāgyajananaṃ sarvaśatrunivāraṇam asyārthaḥ tatra prāgvat🔽ṣaṭkoṇamālikhya tasya sandhiṣaṭke trikoṇaṣaṭkaṃ yathā vyaktaṃ bhavati tathā
analyzed: sarva saubhāgya jananam sarva śatru nivāraṇam asya arthaḥ tatra prāgvat  ṣaṭkoṇam ālikhya tasya sandhi ṣaṭke trikoṇa ṣaṭkam yathā vyaktam bhavati tathā
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: There, as before,🔽one should draw a hexagon and in the six junctions of that, a set of six triangles should be clearly drawn.

original: gurūktayuktyā ṣaṭkoṇāntaraṃ vilikhya tanmadhye prāgvat🔽sādhyasādhakakarmayuktaṃ śaktibījamālikhya tatpratilomena🔽vyāhṛtibhirveṣṭayet taduktamācāryaiḥ
analyzed: guru ukta yuktyā ṣaṣ koṇa antaram vilikhya tad madhye prāgvat  sādhya sādhaka karma yuktam śakti bījam ālikhya tad pratilomena  vyāhṛtibhiḥ veṣṭayet tat uktam ācāryaiḥ
translated: Following the method stated by the teacher, one should draw the inner hexagon and in its center, as before,🔽one should write the seed syllable of Śakti along with the object of attainment, the performer, and the action, and encircle it with the Vyāhṛtis in the reverse order. This has been stated by the teachers:

original: śaktiṃ praveṣṭayecca pratilomavyāhṛtibhirantasthāmiti tato
analyzed: śaktim praveṣṭayet ca pratiloma vyāhṛtibhiḥ antasthām iti
translated: One should also enclose the Śakti with the Vyāhṛtis in the reverse order, along with the inner vowels. Then,

original: dvādaśatrikoṇodareṣu duṃ iti durgābījaṃ volikhya teṣveva sānusvāraṃ
analyzed: dvādaśa trikoṇa udareṣu duṃ iti durgā bījam vā ulikhya teṣu eva sa anusvāram
translated: In the twelve triangles, write the seed syllable dum for Durga, and in those very triangles, with the nasal sound,

original: caturthasvaraṃ likhet taduktamācāryacaraṇaiḥ
analyzed: caturtha svaram likhet tat uktam ācārya caraṇaiḥ
translated: In the twelve triangular cavities, write the seed syllable duṃ of Durgā, and in those very [cavities], write the fourth vowel with the anusvāra,🔽as stated by the venerable teacher:

original: ravikoṇeṣu durantāṃ māyāṃ likhedadyātra bindumatīmiti tato
analyzed: ravi koṇeṣu durantām māyām likhet adya atra bindumatīm iti
translated: In the triangular [cavities], one should write the syllable 'duṃ' ending with 'ra' and having the bindu. Then,

original: dvādaśatrikoṇapārśvadvaye pratipārśvamekamiti krameṇa🔽vaidikagāyatryāścaturviṃśativarṇān sabindūn prādakṣiṇyena pratilomagatān
analyzed: dvādaśa trikoṇa pārśva dvaye pratipārśvam ekam iti krameṇa  vaidika gāyatryāḥ caturviṃśati varṇān sa bindūn prādakṣiṇyena pratiloma gatān
translated: in the two sides of the twelve triangles, one on each side, in order,

original: vilikhet uktañcācāryacaraṇaiḥ gāyatrīṃ pratilomataḥ pravilikhedagneḥ
analyzed: vilikhet uktam ca ācārya caraṇaiḥ gāyatrīm pratilomataḥ pravilikhet agneḥ
translated: write the twenty-four letters of the Vedic Gāyatrī, with the bindu, counterclockwise, in the reverse order. It is also stated by the venerable teacher: One should write the Gāyatrī in the reverse order, on the cheek of Agni.

original: kapolamiti tataḥ pūrvavaddvādaśa trikoṇāgreṣu śaktibījāni vilikhya tāni
analyzed: kapolam iti tatas pūrvavat dvādaśa trikoṇa agreṣu śakti bījāni vilikhya tāni
translated: Then, as before, write the seed syllables of Śakti on the tips of the twelve triangles,

original: parasparaṃ pūrvavadekāntaritaṃ badhnīyāt tadbahirvṛttadvayaṃ vidhāya
analyzed: parasparam pūrvavat eka antaritam badhnīyāt tad bahis vṛtta dvayam vidhāya
translated: and bind them together, alternating with each other as before. Having made two concentric circles outside that,

original: tayorantarālagatavīthyām
analyzed: tayoḥ antarāla gata vīthyām
translated: in the alleyway located between them,

original: jātavedase sunavāma somamarātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ /
analyzed: jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyataḥ ni dahāti vedaḥ
translated: We shall press the Soma for Jātavedas, the Veda burns away the enemy.

original: sa naḥ parṣadati durgāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritātyagniḥ / ṛgvedaḥ ///
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣadati durgāṇi viśvā nāvā iva sindhum duritā ati agniḥ  ṛgvedaḥ
translated: He carries us across all difficulties, like a boat across the river, Agni. The Ṛg Veda.

original: iti triṣṭubhmaṃtrasya sabindubhirvarṇaiḥ pratilomena veṣṭayet
analyzed: iti triṣṭubh maṃtrasya sa bindubhiḥ varṇaiḥ pratilomena veṣṭayet
translated: Thus, with the syllables of the Tristubh mantra along with the bindu, one should encircle in the reverse order.

original: uktañcācāryacaraṇaiḥ
analyzed: uktam ca ācārya caraṇaiḥ
translated: And it is said by the feet of the teacher:

original: bahiśca racayedbhūyastathā triṣṭubhamiti
analyzed: bahis ca racayet bhūyas tathā triṣṭubham iti
translated: And again, one should fashion outside in the same way with the Tristubh.

original: tatra śrīpadmapādācāryavyākhyā tathā triṣṭubhamiti pratilomenetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: tatra śrī padma pāda ācārya vyākhyā tathā triṣṭubham iti pratilomena iti arthaḥ
translated: There, the explanation by the illustrious teacher Padmapada is: with the Tristubh means in the reverse order.

original: tataḥ prāgvadanulomamātṛkayā vilomamātṛkayā ca saṃveṣṭya🔽tadbahiraṣṭakoṇaṃ kṛtvā prāgvattattatkoṇeṣu nṛsiṃhabījaṃ cintāmaṇibījaṃ
analyzed: tatas prāgvat anuloma mātṛkayā viloma mātṛkayā ca saṃveṣṭya  tad bahis aṣṭa koṇam kṛtvā prāgvat tad tad koṇeṣu nṛsiṃha bījam cintāmaṇi bījam
translated: Then, having encircled as before with the forward alphabet and the reverse alphabet,

original: ca vilikhya tathaiva ṣoḍaśaśūlayuktaṃ kuryādityetadyantramuktaphaladaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ca vilikhya tathā eva ṣoḍaśa śūla yuktam kuryāt iti etat yantram ukta phala dam bhavati
translated: having made an eight-cornered [figure] outside that, having written as before the Narasimha seed and the Cintamani seed in those corners, one should make it endowed with sixteen spears in the same way. This yantra gives the stated results.

original: siṃ siṃ pṛ // //
analyzed: siṃ siṃ pṛ
translated: Siṃ siṃ

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: likhet sarojaṃ rasapatrayuktaṃ madhye daleṣvapyabhilikhya māyām /

translated: Terrible, clad in elephant hide, adorned with curly locks, splendid,

analyzed: tad sahasram prajuhuyāt japa ante mantra vittamaḥ

analyzed: arcayet parameśāni vakṣyamāṇa krameṇa tām
translated: One should worship her, O Supreme Goddess, in the sequence to be described.

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: The petals.

original: hṛllekhādyā yajedādau karṇikāyāṃ yathāvidhi /
analyzed: hṛllekhā ādyāḥ yajet ādau karṇikāyām yathāvidhi
translated: One should worship Hridaya-Lekha and others first, in the pericarp, according to the rules.

analyzed: aṅgāni keśareṣu syuḥ patra sthāḥ mātaraḥ kramāt

translated: Indra and others should be worshipped again, and their weapons outside of that.

analyzed: evam sampūjayet devīm sākṣāt vaiśravaṇaḥ bhavet  rajyate sakalaiḥ lokaiḥ tejasā bhāskara upamaḥ

analyzed: anena adhiṣṭhitam geham niśi dīpa śikhā ākulam

analyzed: sarṣapaiḥ lāja saṃmiśraiḥ rājya arthe juhuyāt niśi
translated: One should offer oblations at night with mustard seeds mixed with parched rice for the sake of kingdom.

original: rājānaṃ vaśayet sadyastatpatnīmapi sādhakaḥ /🔽annavānannahomena śrīmān padmahutādbhavet // //
analyzed: rājānam vaśayet sadyas tad patnīm api sādhakaḥ  annavān anna homena śrīmān padma hutāt bhavet
translated: The practitioner can subjugate the king and even his wife immediately.🔽By offering oblations of food, one becomes wealthy with food, and by offering oblations of lotuses, one becomes prosperous.

original: rājavṛkṣasamudbhūtaiḥ puṣpairhutvā kavirbhavet /
analyzed: rājavṛkṣa samudbhūtaiḥ puṣpaiḥ hutvā kaviḥ bhavet
translated: By offering oblations with flowers from the royal tree, one becomes a poet.

original: arogo tilahomena ghṛtenāyuravāpnuyāt // //
analyzed: tila homena ghṛtena āyuḥ avāpnuyāt
translated: By offering oblations of sesame seeds, one becomes free from disease, and by offering oblations of ghee, one attains longevity.

original: prākproktānyapi karmāṇi sādhayet sādhakottamaḥ /
analyzed: prāc proktāni api karmāṇi sādhayet sādhaka uttamaḥ
translated: The best of practitioners should accomplish the rites mentioned earlier.

original: ālikhyāṣṭadigargalānyudaragaṃ pāśādikaṃ tryakṣaraṃ
analyzed: ālikhya aṣṭa diś argalāni udara gam pāśa ādikam tri akṣaram
translated: Having written the eight directions, the belly, the noose etc., the three-syllabled one,

original: koṣṭheṣvaṅgamanūdareṣu manūn pareṣu
analyzed: koṣṭheṣu aṅga manu udareṣu manūn pareṣu
translated: in the compartments, the limbs, in the bellies, the mantras, in the others,

original: vilikhedaṣṭārṇamantradvayam /🔽acpūrvāparaṣaṭkayuglayavarān vyomāsanāmargale
analyzed: vilikhet aṣṭa arṇa mantra dvayam  a c pūrva apara ṣaṭka yuj laya varān vyomāsanām argale
translated: one should write the two eight-syllabled mantras.🔽Having written the two pairs of six beginning with a, the excellent ones, in the bolts named after the sky,

original: ṣvālikhyendrajalādhipādiguṇaśaḥ paṃktidvayaṃ tatparam atra🔽viṣamapadavyākhyā acpūrveti acāṃ svarāṇāṃ napuṃsakavyatiriktānām /
analyzed: ṣu ālikhya indra jalādhipa ādi guṇaśas paṃkti dvayam tat param atra  viṣama pada vyākhyā a c pūrvā iti a cām svarāṇām napuṃsaka vyatiriktānām
translated: the two rows of letters, Indra, the lord of water, etc., in order, above that,

original: pūrvaṣaṭkaṃ a ā i ī u ū / aparaṣaṭkaṃ e ai o au aṃ aḥ / etadyuktān layavarān /
analyzed: pūrva ṣaṭkam a ā i ī u ū apara ṣaṭkam e ai o au aṃ aḥ etad yuktān laya varān
translated: Here is the explanation of the irregular words: A-pūrva means the six beginning with a, namely a, ā, i, ī, u, ū, and the six ending with a, namely e, ai, o, au, aṃ, aḥ. The excellent ones are associated with these.

original: vyomāsanān vyoma hakārastatrāsanā sthitiryeṣāṃ tādṛśām / indrajalādhipādi
analyzed: vyoma āsanān vyoma hakāraḥ tatra āsanā sthitiḥ yeṣām tādṛśām indra jalādhipa ādi
translated: Those who are seated in the sky, the sky is the letter ha, and those who are seated there, like Indra, the lord of water, etc.

original: pūrvapaścimādi / guṇaśaḥ akṣaratritayakrameṇa / aṣṭayugārṇaṃ ṣoḍaśārṇam /
analyzed: pūrva paścima ādi guṇaśas akṣara tritaya krameṇa aṣṭa yuga arṇam ṣoḍaśa arṇam
translated: East, west, etc. By the method of qualities, in the sequence of three letters, the eight-couplet verse, the sixteen-letter verse.

original: ātmasahitāṃ yugmasvarāntargatāṃ māyāmiti / ātmā haṃsaḥ māyāśabdenātra
analyzed: ātma sahitām yugma svara antargatām māyām iti ātmā haṃsaḥ māyā śabdena atra
translated: Along with the self, within the pair of vowels, the illusion, thus. The self is the hamsa. By the word illusion,

original: caturthasvaro jñeyaḥ / tathā ca nighaṇṭumātṛkāyāṃ
analyzed: caturtha svaraḥ jñeyaḥ tathā ca nighaṇṭu mātṛkāyām
translated: the fourth vowel should be known here. And thus in the Nighaṇṭu Mātṛkā,

original: īstrimūrtirvāmanetraṃ śekharaḥ kauṭilastathā /
analyzed: īḥ trimūrtiḥ vāmanetram śekharaḥ kauṭilaḥ tathā
translated: Ī is the three-formed, the left eye, the crest, and the crooked one.

original: vāgmī śuddhaśca jihvākhyo māyāviṣṇuḥ prakāśitaḥ // ityukteḥ /
analyzed: vāgmī śuddhaḥ ca jihvā ākhyaḥ māyā viṣṇuḥ prakāśitaḥ iti ukteḥ
translated: The eloquent one, the pure one, called the tongue, the illusory Viṣṇu, is revealed. Thus it is said.

original: ātmasahitayugmasvarāntargatamāyālekhanakramastu dakṣiṇāmurtisaṃhitāyām
analyzed: ātma sahita yugma svara antargata māyā lekhana kramaḥ tu dakṣiṇāmurtisaṃhitāyām
translated: The sequence of writing the illusion within the pair of vowels along with the self is in the Dakṣiṇāmūrti Saṃhitā,

original: haṃsaḥ padaṃ vāmanetraṃ bindvinduparibhūṣitaṃ /
analyzed: haṃsaḥ padam vāmanetram bindu indu paribhūṣitam
translated: The hamsa foot, the left eye, adorned with the bindu and the moon.

original: punarhaṃsaḥ padaṃ caitat pañcārṇammanumālikhet //
analyzed: punar haṃsaḥ padam ca etat pañca arṇam manum ālikhet
translated: Again, this hamsa foot, one should write this five-lettered mantra.

original: svaradvandvodaragataṃ saptārṇaṃ cāṣṭadhā bhavet / iti //
analyzed: svara dvandva udara gatam sapta arṇam ca aṣṭadhā bhavet iti
translated: Located in the belly of the pair of vowels, the seven-lettered one becomes eightfold. Thus.

original: tena aṃ haṃsaḥ īṃ haṃsaḥ āṃ ityādikrameṇa kesareṣu sapta sapta varṇā lekhyāḥ
analyzed: tena aṃ haṃsaḥ īṃ haṃsaḥ āṃ ityādi krameṇa kesareṣu sapta sapta varṇāḥ lekhyāḥ
translated: Therefore, the letters should be written in the petals, seven by seven, in the sequence beginning with aṃ haṃsa īṃ haṃsa āṃ.

original: prapañcasārepyetad yantranirmāṇamuktaṃ yathā🔽aṣṭāśāntargatāvirhalayavarayutācpūrvapāścātyaṣaṭkaṃ
analyzed: prapañcasāre pi etat yantra nirmāṇam uktam yathā  aṣṭa āśā antargata aviḥ ha la ya vara yuta a c pūrva pāścātya ṣaṭkam
translated: This construction of the yantra is also mentioned in Prapañcasāra as follows:🔽The group of six in the east and west, along with the eight and ya, inside the eight directions,

original: koṇodyatsvāṅgasāṣṭākṣarayugayugalāṣṭākṣarākhyaṃ bahiśca /🔽māyopetāt sayugmasvaramilitalasatkesaraṃ sāṣṭapatraṃ
analyzed: koṇa udyat sva aṅga sa aṣṭa akṣara yuga yugala aṣṭa akṣara ākhyam bahis ca  māyā upetāt sa yugma svara milita lasat kesaram sa aṣṭa patram
translated: The petals with eight syllables, two pairs of eight syllables, rising from the corners, with its own parts, outside,🔽The lotus with eight petals, along with the pairs of vowels, with shining filaments, endowed with Māyā,

original: padmaṃ tanmadhyapaṅktitritayaparilasatpāśaśaktyaṅkuśārṇam // //
analyzed: padmam tad madhya paṅkti tritaya parilasat pāśa śakti aṅkuśa arṇam
translated: The group of three lines in the middle of that lotus, shining with the syllables of the noose, Śakti, and goad.

original: pāśāṅkuśāvṛtamanupratilomagaiśca varṇaiḥ sarojapuṭitena ghaṭena cāpi /
analyzed: pāśa aṅkuśa āvṛtam anupratiloma gaiḥ ca varṇaiḥ saroja puṭitena ghaṭena ca api
translated: The lotus cup, along with the syllables in the reverse order of the noose and goad, and also with the pot,

original: āvītamiṣṭaphalabhadraghaṭaṃ tadetadyantrottamantviti ghaṭārgalanāmadheym ////
analyzed: āvītam iṣṭa phala bhadra ghaṭam tat etat yantra uttamantu iti ghaṭārgala nāmadheym
translated: That is the auspicious pot of desired fruits, covered, this is the best yantra, named Ghaṭārgala.

original: prākpratyagargale halamatha punarāgneyamārute ca hayam /
analyzed: prāc pratyak argale halam atha punar āgneya mārute ca hayam
translated: The syllable ha in the east and west, then the syllable ha in the southeast and southwest,

original: dakṣottare havārṇaṃ nairṛtaśaive dvipaṅktiśo vilikhet // //
analyzed: dakṣa uttare hava arṇam nairṛta śaive dvi paṅktiśas vilikhet
translated: The syllable va in the northeast and northwest, one should write in two rows in the northwest and northeast.

original: vilikhecca karṇikāyāṃ pāśāṅkuśasādhyasaṃyutāṃ śaktim /
analyzed: vilikhet ca karṇikāyām pāśa aṅkuśa sādhya saṃyutām śaktim
translated: And one should write the Śakti, along with the noose, goad, and the object of attainment, in the pericarp.

original: abhyantarasthakoṣṭhesvaṅgānyavaśeṣiteṣu cāṣṭārṇe // //
analyzed: abhyantara stha koṣṭheṣu aṅgāni avaśeṣiteṣu ca aṣṭa arṇe
translated: In the inner square and in the remaining eight-syllable squares, one's own limbs.

original: koṣṭheṣu ṣoḍaśasvatha ṣoḍaṣavarṇaṃ manuṃ tathā mantrī /
analyzed: koṣṭheṣu ṣoḍaśasu atha ṣoḍaṣa varṇam manum tathā mantrī
translated: And in the sixteen squares, the sixteen-syllable mantra, in the same way, the reciter.

original: padmasya kesareṣu ca yugasvarātmānivitāṃ tathā māyām // //
analyzed: padmasya kesareṣu ca tathā māyām
translated: And Maya, consisting of the Yugma vowels, in the filaments of the lotus.

original: ekaikeṣu daleṣu triśastriśaḥ karṇikāgatān maṃtrān /🔽pāśāṅkuśabījābhyāṃ praveṣṭayedbāhyataśca nalinasya // //🔽anulomavilomagataiḥ praveṣṭayedakṣaraiśca tadbāhye /
analyzed: ekaikeṣu daleṣu triśas triśas karṇikā gatān maṃtrān  pāśa aṅkuśa bījābhyām praveṣṭayet bāhyatas ca nalinasya  anuloma viloma gataiḥ praveṣṭayet akṣaraiḥ ca tad bāhye
translated: In each petal, three times each, the mantras located in the pericarp,🔽One should insert with the seed syllables of the noose and goad, and also outside the lotus.🔽With the syllables moving in the forward and reverse order, one should insert them outside that.

original: tadanu ghaṭena sarojasthitena tadvaktrake'bujaṃ vilikhet // //
analyzed: tadanu ghaṭena saroja sthitena tad vaktra kebujam vilikhet
translated: Then, with the pot located in the lotus, one should inscribe the lotus face in its mouth.

original: sārasaṃgrahe
translated: In the Essence Collection

original: ghaṭārgalābhidhaṃ yaṃtraṃ sarvasampatkaraṃ param / // //🔽kośeṣvaṣṭayugārṇamātmasadṛśāṃ sahitāṃ yugmasvarāntargatāṃ🔽māyāṃ kesaragāṃ daleṣu vilikhen mūlaṃ tripaṅktiḥ kramāt /
analyzed: ghaṭārgala abhidham yaṃtram sarva sampad karam param  kośeṣu aṣṭa yuga arṇam ātma sadṛśām sahitām yugma svara antargatām  māyām kesara gām daleṣu vilikhet mūlam tri paṅktiḥ kramāt
translated: The yantra called Ghatargala is supreme in bestowing all prosperity.🔽In the compartments, one should write the Maya consisting of eight Yugma letters, along with those similar to one's own, within the Yugma vowels, located in the filaments, and the root in three rows in sequence.

original: triḥpāśāṅkuśaveṣṭitaṃ lipibhirāvītaṃ kramādvyutkramāt
analyzed: tris pāśa aṅkuśa veṣṭitam lipibhiḥ āvītam kramāt vyutkramāt
translated: It should be encircled three times with the noose and goad, and wrapped with the letters in the forward and reverse order.

original: padmasthena ghaṭena paṅkajamukhenāveṣṭitaṃ tadbahiḥ // //
analyzed: padma sthena ghaṭena paṅkaja mukhena āveṣṭitam tat bahis
translated: Outside that, it should be encircled with the pot located in the lotus, with the lotus face.

original: ghaṭārgalamidaṃ yaṃtraṃ mantriṇāṃ prābhṛtaṃ matam /
analyzed: ghaṭa argalam idam yaṃtram mantriṇām prābhṛtam matam
translated: This yantra called Ghatargala is considered a gift for the reciters of mantras.

original: pāśaśrīśaktikandarpakāmaśaktyādiraṅkuśaḥ śaktīndirāṅkuśāḥ
translated: The goad consists of the powers of the noose, Shri, Shakti, Kandarpa, Kama, Shakti, etc. The powers are Indira and the goads.

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: prathamo'ṣṭākṣaro mantrastataḥ kāmini rañjini /
analyzed: prathama uṣṭa akṣaraḥ mantraḥ tatas kāmini rañjini
translated: The first mantra is of eight syllables, then Kaminī Rañjini,

original: svāhāṃtoṣṭākṣaraḥ sadbhiraparaḥ kīrtito manuḥ // //
analyzed: svāhā aṃtaḥ ūṣṭa akṣaraḥ sadbhiḥ aparaḥ kīrtitaḥ manuḥ
translated: The other mantra of eight syllables ending with Svāhā is declared by the virtuous.

original: hrīṃ gauri rudradayite yogeśvari savarma phaṭ /
analyzed: hrīṃ gauri rudra dayite yogeśvari sa varma phaṭ
translated: Hrīṃ Gaurī, beloved of Rudra, Yogeśvarī, with armor, phaṭ.

original: dviṭhāntaḥ ṣoḍaśārṇo'yaṃ mantraḥ sadbhirudīritaḥ // //
analyzed: dviṭha antaḥ ṣoḍaśa arṇaḥ yam mantraḥ sadbhiḥ udīritaḥ  /
translated: This mantra of sixteen syllables ending with Vidyā is proclaimed by the virtuous.

original: likhitvā bhūrjapatrādau yantramadhye mantrametat yathāvidhi /
analyzed: likhitvā bhūrja patra ādau yantra madhye mantram etat yathāvidhi
translated: Having written this mantra on a birch bark leaf or in the middle of a yantra, as per procedure,

original: dhāryedvāmabāhau vā kaṇṭhe vā nijamūrddhani // //🔽p /
analyzed: dhāryet vāma bāhau vā kaṇṭhe vā nija mūrddhani  p
translated: It should be worn on the left arm, on the neck, or on one's own head.

original: vaśayet sakalān devān martyān viśeṣeṇa mahīpatīn /🔽nīlapaṭṭe vilikhyaitadguṭikīkṛtya tatpunaḥ sādhyapratikṛtau🔽sikthanirmitāyāṃ hṛdi nyaset /
analyzed: vaśayet sakalān devān martyān viśeṣeṇa mahīpatīn  nīla paṭṭe vilikhya etat guṭikīkṛtya tat punar sādhya pratikṛtau  siktha nirmitāyām hṛdi nyaset
translated: One can subjugate all gods, and especially mortals and kings.🔽Having written this on a blue cloth, made it into a pill, and placed it in the heart of an effigy made of rice flour of the person to be subjugated,

original: pātre trimadhurāpūrṇe nikṣipyaināṃ vidhānataḥ //
analyzed: pātre trimadhura āpūrṇe nikṣipya enām vidhānataḥ
translated: One should place it in a vessel filled with the three sweet things, according to procedure.

original: sampūjya gandhapuṣpādyairbaliṃ nikṣipya rātriṣu /
analyzed: sampūjya gandha puṣpa ādyaiḥ balim nikṣipya rātriṣu
translated: Having worshipped it with scents, flowers, etc., and offered oblations at night,

original: mūlamaṃtraṃ japenmantrī nityamaṣṭasahasrakam //
analyzed: mūlamaṃtram japet mantrī nityam aṣṭa sahasrakam
translated: The reciter of mantras should always recite the root mantra eight thousand times.

original: saptāhād vāñchitāṃ nārīmāharetsmaravihvalām /
analyzed: sapta ahāt vāñchitām nārīm āharet smara vihvalām
translated: Within seven days, he will bring a desired woman, overwhelmed with passion.

original: bhūrjapatre vilikhyaitad guṭikīkṛtya tatpunaḥ // iti śāradātilake viśeṣaḥ //
analyzed: bhūrja patre vilikhya etat guṭikīkṛtya tat punar iti śāradātilake viśeṣaḥ
translated: Having written this on a birch bark leaf, it should be made into a pill again. This is a special instruction in Sharadatilaka.

original: lākṣayā tāmrarajatakāñcanairveṣṭayet kramāt /
analyzed: lākṣayā tāmra rajata kāñcanaiḥ veṣṭayet kramāt
translated: It should be wrapped with lac, copper, silver and gold in order.

original: tatkumbhe nyasya sampūjya yathāvad bhuvaneśvarīm // //
analyzed: tad kumbhe nyasya sampūjya yathāvat bhuvaneśvarīm
translated: Having placed it in a pot and worshipped Bhuvaneśvarī as prescribed,

original: saṃspṛśya tajjapenmantraṃ yathāvidhi divākara sahasrakam /
analyzed: saṃspṛśya tat japet mantram yathāvidhi divākara sahasrakam
translated: one should touch it and recite the mantra a thousand times, as per procedure, in the daytime.

original: abhiṣicya priyaṃ sādhyaṃ badhnīyādghaṭamāśikham yantra // //🔽kāntiṃ puṣṭiṃ dhanā dharā rogyaśreyāṃsi yaśāṃsi
analyzed: abhiṣicya priyam sādhyam badhnīyāt ghaṭam āśikham  kāntim puṣṭim dhanā dharāḥ rogya śreyāṃsi yaśāṃsi
translated: Having consecrated the beloved object to be accomplished, one should bind the pot up to the top with the yantra.🔽A man obtains radiance, nourishment, wealth, health, prosperity, fame,

original: labhate naraḥ /
analyzed: labhate naraḥ
translated: and good fortune.

original: vākkāyamanasā kṛtya bhittau vilikhya tadyantraṃ
analyzed: vāc kāya manasā kṛtya bhittau vilikhya tat yantram
translated: Having written that yantra on a wall with body, speech and mind,

original: pūjayennityamādarāt // //
analyzed: pūjayet nityam ādarāt
translated: one should always worship it with respect.

original: bhūtapretapiśācāśca na vīkṣitumapi kṣamāḥ /
analyzed: bhūta preta piśācāḥ ca na vīkṣitum api kṣamāḥ
translated: Bhutas, pretas and pisacas are not even able to look at it.

original: tadvilikhya śirastrāṇe sādhayeddhāritaṃ bhaṭaḥ // //
analyzed: tat vilikhya śirastrāṇe sādhayet hāritam bhaṭaḥ
translated: Having written it on a head-covering, a warrior should accomplish it by wearing it.

original: yuddhe bahūn ripūn hatvā jayamāpnoti pārthivaḥ /🔽vajrāṅkite vahnipuradvaye tāṃ pāśāṅkuśābhītisadasti
analyzed: yuddhe bahūn ripūn hatvā jayam āpnoti pārthivaḥ  vajra aṅkite vahni pura dvaye tām pāśa aṅkuśa abhīti sad asti
translated: In a battle, the king kills many enemies and attains victory.🔽In the two cities marked by the thunderbolt, that which has the noose, goad, abhaya mudra and sadastri

original: pāśāṅkuśābhyāmudarastha sādhyām /
analyzed: pāśa aṅkuśābhyām udara stha sādhyām
translated: with the noose and goad located in the belly,

original: madhye'ṣṭakoṇe purabāhupadme madhye'thakoṇeṣvatha bāhyavṛtte
analyzed: madhya iṣṭa koṇe pura bāhu padme bāhya vṛtte
translated: In the middle, in the eight-angled city, in the lotus of the arms, in the middle, then in the corners, and in the outer circle,

original: punaḥ punastāṃ vilikhet samantāt // //
analyzed: punar punar tām vilikhet samantāt
translated: One should draw it again and again all around.

original: bhūrje likhitametatsyādbhuktimuktiphalapradam sarvavaśyakaraṃ nṛṇām🔽
analyzed: bhūrje likhitam etat syāt bhukti mukti phala pradam sarva vaśya karam nṛṇām  śā
translated: This should be written on birch bark, it grants the fruits of enjoyment and liberation, and makes all men controllable.

original: ārogyaiśvaryajananaṃ yuddheṣu vijayapradam // //
analyzed: ārogya aiśvarya jananam yuddheṣu vijaya pradam
translated: It generates health and prosperity, and grants victory in battles.

original: likhet saroje bhūrje saroje ityapi kvacit pāṭhaḥ sakale'marāḍhyo
analyzed: likhet saroje bhūrje saroje iti api kvacid pāṭhaḥ sakala imara āḍhyaḥ
translated: One should write it on a lotus, on birch bark, or on a lotus, as written in some places. In the complete, prosperous,

original: svarakesarāḍhye vasvaśrapatre vargāṣṭapatre
analyzed: svara kesara āḍhye śā vasu aśra patre varga aṣṭa patre
translated: endowed with vowels and filaments, eight-petaled lotus,

original: vasudhāpurasthe /
analyzed: śā vasudhā pura sthe
translated: situated in the city of the earth.🔽One should write in the middle, along with the object of attainment, the Māyā, which is connected

translated: Again, having performed the Nyasa of the six limbs beginning with the Rishi, offered the Japa, and dedicated one's own duties,

original: samarpayet
analyzed: samarpayet
translated: one should dedicate:

original: ahaṃ devī na cānyo'smi brahmaivāhaṃ na śokabhāk /
analyzed: aham devī na ca anyaḥ asmi brahmā eva aham na śoka bhāj
translated: I am the Goddess, none else; I am Brahman itself, not subject to sorrow.

original: saccidānandarūpo'haṃ svātmānamiti cintayet //
analyzed: saccidānanda rūpaḥ uham sva ātmānam iti cintayet
translated: I am of the nature of existence, knowledge and bliss; I am the Self. Thus one should think.

original: prātaḥ prabhṛti sāyāntaṃ sāyādi prātarantataḥ /
analyzed: prātar prabhṛti sāya antam sāya ādi prātar antataḥ
translated: From morning till evening, from evening till morning,

analyzed: yat karomi jagadyone tat astu tava pūjanam
translated: Whatever I do, O Mother of the universe, may that be your worship.

original: iti samarpya svakāryānuṣṭhānāya
analyzed: iti samarpya sva kārya anuṣṭhānāya
translated: Having thus dedicated, for the performance of one's own duties,

original: trailokyacaitanyamaye pareśi bhuvaneśvari tvaccaraṇājñayaiva /
analyzed: trailokya caitanya maye parā īśi bhuvaneśvari tvad caraṇa ājñayā eva
translated: O Supreme Goddess, the consciousness of the three worlds, O Mistress of the universe, by your very command,

analyzed: prātar samutthāya tava priya artham saṃsāra yātrām anurvatayiṣye  /

analyzed: saṃsāra yātrām anuvarttamānam tvad ājñayā śrī bhuvaneśvarī īśi
translated: O Goddess Bhuvaneshvari, while continuing in the worldly life by your command,

original: sparddhātiraskāraka / pramādabhayāni māṃ mābhibhavantu mātaḥ // //
analyzed: sparddhā tiraskāraka pramāda bhayāni mām mā abhibhavantu mātar  /
translated: O Mother, let rivalry, contempt, carelessness and fear not overcome me.

original: jānāmi dharmaṃ na ca me pravṛttirjānāmyadharmaṃ na ca me nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: jānāmi dharmam na ca me pravṛttiḥ jānāmi adharmam na ca me nivṛttiḥ
translated: I know what is right, but I am not inclined towards it; I know what is wrong, but I am not averse to it.

original: tvayā hṛṣīkeśi hṛdisthayā'haṃ yathā niyuktosmi tathā'carāmi // //
analyzed: tvayā hṛṣīkeśi hṛdisthayā aham yathā niyuktaḥ asmi tathā ācarāmi
translated: O Hrishikesha, by you, O Hrishikesha, residing in the heart, I act as I am directed.

analyzed: iti devī ājñām prārthya ajapa ajapam sahaja siddham tad tad devatābhyaḥ saṃkalpam  samarpayet adya pūrvedyus ahar rātra ācaritam ucchvāsa niḥśvāsa ātmakam  ṣaṣ śata adhikam ekaviṃśati sahasra saṃkhyākam ajapa ajapam
translated: Having thus requested the Goddess's command, one should offer the effortless Japa to the respective deities.🔽Today, in the previous day, and in the day and night, the Japa of twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths,🔽which is in the form of inhalation and exhalation,

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: mūlādhārasvādhiṣṭhanamaṇipūrakānāhataviśuddhājñābrahmaraṃdhreṣu

translated: In the root support, the svādhiṣṭhāna, the maṇipūraka, the ānāhata, the viśuddha, the ājñā, and the brahma-randhra,

analyzed: caturdala ṣaḍdala daśadala dvādaśadala ṣoḍaśadala dvidala sahasradaleṣu

analyzed: svarṇa vidruma nīla piṅgala dhūmra vidyut karpūra varṇeṣu

original: samarpayāmi namaḥ /🔽ṣaṭśataṃ gaṇanāthasya ṣaṭsahasraṃ pitāmahe /
analyzed: samarpayāmi namaḥ  ṣaṭśatam gaṇanāthasya ṣaṣ sahasram pitāmahe
translated: Salutations.🔽Six hundred to Gaṇanātha, six thousand to the grandfather,

analyzed: śaṭsahasram gadā pāṇau ṣaṣ sahasram pinākine

analyzed: sahasram gurave dadyāt etat saṃkhyā samarpaṇam
translated: and a thousand to the guru - this is the offering of the number.

translated: Salutations. Om Aim Hrim Shrim To Rudra residing in the anahata chakra, I offer six thousand repetitions of the ajapa mantra.🔽Salutations. Om Aim Hrim Shrim To the supreme self residing in the ajna chakra, I offer one thousand repetitions of the ajapa mantra.

original: sahasradalakamalakarṇikāmadhye vartinyai śrīgurupādukāyai ajapājapānāṃ

analyzed: sthānāya namaḥ mūrddhni hemāya varṇāya hamaḥ sarva aṅge iti vinyasya

analyzed: kara ṣaṣ aṅga nyāsau ca kuryāt om aim   śrīṃ   sūrya ātmane

translated: Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsim to Soma, the soul, to the thumbs, salutations. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsum to the stainless one, the soul, to the middle fingers, Vashat.

analyzed: śrīṃ hsaṃḥ avyakta bodha ātmane kara tala kara pṛṣṭhābhyām phaṭ  p  om aim   śrīṃ   sūrya ātmane hṛdayāya namaḥ om aim   śrīṃ
translated: Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaim to the one without appearance, the soul, to the ring fingers, Hum. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaum to the subtle body, the soul, to the little fingers, Vaushat. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsam to the unmanifest consciousness, the soul, to the palms and backs of the hands, Phat.

translated: Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaam to the sun, the soul, to the heart, salutations. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsim to the moon, the soul, to the head, Svâhâ. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsum to the stainless one, the soul, to the tuft,

original: avyaktabodhātmane astrāya phaṭ iti karaṣaḍaṅganyāsau ca kṛtvā dhyānaṃ🔽kuryāt
analyzed: avyakta bodha ātmane astrāya phaṭ iti kara ṣaṣ aṅganyāsau ca kṛtvā dhyānam 🔽kuryāt
translated: Vashat. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaim to the one without appearance, the soul, to the armor, Hum. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaum to the subtle body, the soul, to the three eyes, Vaushat. Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsam to the unmanifest consciousness, the soul, to the weapon, Phat. Having performed the six-limbed nyasa of the hands, one should meditate.

original: dyāṃ mūrdhānaṃ yasya viprā vadaṃti khaṃ vai nābhiṃ caṃndrasūryau ca netre /
analyzed: dyām mūrdhānam yasya viprāḥ vadaṃti kham vai nābhim caṃndra sūryau ca netre
translated: The Brahmins say that the sky is his head, the space is his navel, the moon and sun are his eyes,

analyzed: pañcaviṃśati vāram tat anusaṃdhāya japtvā samarpya guru upadiṣṭa mārgeṇa
translated: Recite it twenty-five times, offer it, and following the path instructed by the guru,

analyzed: nāda anusaṃdhāna pūrvakam nirasta samasta upādhinā kena api cit vilāsena
translated: Contemplate that one is engaged in the manifestation of consciousness, which is free from all limitations, preceded by the contemplation of the subtle element of sound.

original: pravartamāno'smīti vibhāvya svakāryānuṣṭhānāya
analyzed: pravartamānaḥ asmi iti vibhāvya sva kārya anuṣṭhānāya
translated: Thinking in this way, for the performance of one's duties,

translated: O Goddess with the ocean as your girdle and the mountains as your breasts,

analyzed: viṣṇu patni namaḥ tubhyam pāda sparśam kṣamasva me
translated: O consort of Vishnu, I bow to you. Please forgive my touching your feet.

original: iti bhūmiṃ saṃprārthya śvāsānusāreṇa tatpadaṃ nidhāya bahirgatvā
analyzed: iti bhūmim saṃprārthya śvāsa anusāreṇa tat padam nidhāya bahis gatvā
translated: Having thus requested the earth, placing that foot in accordance with the breath, going outside,

translated: Having gone to a river etc. with the mantra Klim, salutations to Kamadeva, who is dear to all people,

analyzed: snānam nirvartya tāntrikam ārabhet tatra ādau svāhā mūlam  vidyā tattvāya svāhā mūlam śiva tattvāya svāhā iti ācamya om adya ityādi  amuka māse  amuka pakṣa imuka tithau amuka vāsara imuka nakṣatra yoga karaṇa muhūrteṣu amuka
translated: Having completed the bath, one should commence the Tantric rites. There, first, one should sip water with the root mantra, Om, I shall perform the rite of ablution with the root mantra for the sake of the principle of the individual soul, svaha. Having sipped water thus, Om, today, etc.🔽In such and such a month,🔽in such and such a fortnight, on such and such a lunar day, on such and such a weekday, in conjunction with such and such a lunar mansion, in such and such a karana, and in such and such a muhurta, I shall perform the rite of ablution with the root mantra for the sake of the principle of the individual soul, svaha. The root mantra for the principle of knowledge, svaha. The root mantra for the principle of Shiva, svaha.🔽

original: śarmā'haṃ śrīparadevatāprītaye tāntrikasnānavidhimahaṃ kariṣye iti saṃkalpaṃ

analyzed: tithi rūpā vāra rūpā tathā nakṣatra rūpiṇī

original: p /
analyzed: p

analyzed: nirmalā vimalā śuddhā śudha satvā jaya pradā

analyzed: akṣa mālā dharā devī pāna pātra vidhāriṇī kh g vidhāyinī

analyzed: jananī jana rūpā ca janānām citta hāriṇī

original: śivā /
analyzed: śivā

analyzed: madhura āsanā

analyzed: krīḍā krīḍaka lekhā aṅka kāraṇa ākāra kārikā kh g krīḍā krīḍana khelā  ca khelā karaṇa kārikā

original: mugdhā sādhvī tathā raudrī nānāmūrtividhāriṇī g / nāsti // //
analyzed: mugdhā sādhvī tathā raudrī nānā mūrti vidhāriṇī na asti  /

analyzed: uktāni yāni deveśi anuktāni maheśvari
translated: Whatever has been said, O Goddess of the Lord of Gods, and whatever has not been said, O Great Goddess,

analyzed: yat kiñcid dṛśyate devi tat sarvam bhuvaneśvarī  /
translated: Whatever is seen, O Goddess, all that is the Mistress of the Universe.

analyzed: iti śrī bhuvaneśvaryāḥ nāmāni kathitāni te
translated: Thus, the names of the Goddess of the Universe have been told to you.

analyzed: sahasrāṇi mahādevi phalam teṣām nigadyate
translated: The fruits of those thousands are being declared, O Great Goddess.

analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet prātar utthāya ca arddharātre tathā priye

analyzed: prātaḥkāle tathā madhye sāyāhne hara vallabhe
translated: In the morning, at midday, and in the evening, O Beloved of Hara,

analyzed: yatra tatra paṭhitvā ca bhaktyā siddhiḥ na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: paṭhet vā pāṭhayet vā api śṛṇuyāt śrāvayet tathā

analyzed: tasya sarvam bhavet satyam manasā yat ca vāñchitam  aṣṭamyām ca caturdaśyām navamyām vā viśeṣataḥ

analyzed: p  sarva maṅgala saṃyukte saṃkrātau śani bhaumayoḥ

analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet parayā bhaktyā devyāḥ nāma sahasrakam

original: tasya dehe ca saṃsthanaṃ kurute bhuvaneśvarī /
analyzed: tasya dehe ca saṃsthanam kurute bhuvaneśvarī
translated: that Goddess of the universe will reside in his body.

analyzed: tasya kāryam bhavet devi anyathā na kathañcana
translated: O Goddess, his work will be accomplished, not otherwise at all.

analyzed: śmaśāne prāntare vā api śūnya āgāre catuṣpathe
translated: In a cremation ground, a forest, an empty house, at a crossroads,

analyzed: catuṣpathe ca eka liṅge meru deśe tathā eva ca
translated: at a crossroads, in a solitary shrine, or in a desert region,

analyzed: jala madhye vahni madhye saṃgrāme grāma śāntaye prāṇa saṃśaye

analyzed: japtvā maṃtra sahasram tu vai paṭhet nāma sahasrakam

original: dhūpadīpādibhiścaiva balidānādikaistathā /
analyzed: dhūpa dīpa ādibhiḥ ca eva bali dāna ādikaiḥ tathā
translated: And with incense, lamps, etc., with offerings, etc.,

analyzed: nānāvidhaiḥ tathā devi naivedyaiḥ pakva annaiḥ rbhuvaneśvarīm
translated: and with various kinds of food offerings, O Goddess, he should worship the Goddess of the universe.

original: sampūjya vidhivajjaptvā stutvā nāmasahasrakaiḥ kh / śrutvā
analyzed: sampūjya vidhivat japtvā stutvā nāma sahasrakaiḥ kh śrutvā
translated: Having worshipped and muttered according to the rules, having praised with the thousand names, having listened to

original: nāmasahasrakam /
analyzed: nāma sahasrakam
translated: the thousand names,

analyzed: acirāt siddhim āpnoti sādhakaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ

original: tasya tuṣṭā bhaved devī sarvadā bhuvaneśvarī /
analyzed: tasya tuṣṭā bhavet devī sarvadā bhuvaneśvarī
translated: The goddess Bhuvaneśvarī will always be pleased with him.

analyzed: bhūrja patre samālikhya kuṃkumāt raktacandanaiḥ

analyzed: tathā gorocanā ādyaiḥ ca vilikhya sādhaka uttamaḥ

analyzed: su tithau śubha nakṣtre likhitvā dakṣiṇe bhuje

analyzed: tasya siddhiḥ maheśāni acirāt ca bhaviṣyati

analyzed: devatā vaśam āyāti kim

analyzed: karoti eva na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: iha bhuktvā varān kalau bhogān kṛtvā kāvya artha vistarān

analyzed: kāvyān su dustarān

original: p /
analyzed: p

analyzed: yaḥ idam bhuvaneśvaryāḥ stava rājam maheśvari

analyzed: iti te kathita devi bhuvaneśyāḥ sahasrakam
translated: Thus, O Goddess, I have told you the thousand names of Bhuvaneśī.

analyzed: siddha saṅgha eka sevyam

analyzed: stūyamānaḥ

analyzed: śrīḥ astu

analyzed: śrī gaṇeśāya namaḥ

analyzed: atha śrī bhuvaneśvarī aṣṭottaraśata nāmastotram

analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca

original: mahāsammohinī devī sundarī bhuvaneśvarī /

analyzed: bīja rūpā mahā śaktiḥ saṅgrāme jaya varddhinī

analyzed: sarva śaktiḥ mahā śaktiḥ śarvāṇī parameśvarī

analyzed: icchā jñāna kriyā rūpā aṇima ādi guṇa aṣṭakā

analyzed: namaḥ śivāyai śāntāyai śāṅkari bhuvaneśvari

analyzed: veda vedāṅga rūpā ca ati sūkṣmā śarīriṇī
translated: Having the form of the Vedas and Vedāṅgas, extremely subtle, having a body,

analyzed: kāla antarī kālarūpī saṃjñānām prāṇa dhāriṇī

analyzed: khaḍga śreṣṭhā ca khaṭvāṅgi triśūla vara dhāriṇī  p

analyzed: abhayā lokarakṣā ca pinākī nāga dhāriṇī

analyzed: vajra śaktiḥ mahā śaktiḥ pāśa tomara dhāriṇī
translated: Having a thunderbolt, greatly powerful, holding a noose and a spike,

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa bhujā devī hṛllekhā bhuvanā tathā
translated: The goddess with eighteen arms, Hṛllekhā, and the world,

analyzed: khaḍga dhāri mahā rūpā soma sūrya agni madhya gā

analyzed: evam śatāṣṭakam nāma stotram ramaṇa bhāṣitam
translated: Thus, the hymn named The Hundred and Eight Names of the Beloved is spoken.

original: sarvapāpapraśamanaṃ sarvāriṣṭanivāraṇam /

original: sarvaśatrukṣayakaraṃ sadā vijayavarddhanam // //
analyzed: sarva śatru kṣaya karam sadā vijaya varddhanam
translated: Destroys all enemies, and always increases victory.

original: āyuṣkaraṃ puṣṭikaraṃ rakṣākaraṃ yaśaskaram /
analyzed: āyuṣkaram puṣṭi karam rakṣā karam yaśaskaram
translated: It bestows longevity, nourishment, protection, and fame,

original: amarādipadaiśvaryamamattvāṃśakalāpaham // //
translated: And takes away the portion of the demon's share of immortality and other powers.

original: iti śrīrudrayāmale tantre bhuvaneśvaryaṣṭottaraśatanāma samāptam /
analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale tantre bhuvaneśvarī aṣṭottaraśata nāma samāptam

analyzed: saṃvat phālguna vadi guruvāraḥ
translated: The date is the first day of Phalguna, Thursday, in the Samvat year.

original: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ
analyzed: śrī gaṇeśāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Shri Ganesha.

original: atha śrībhuvaneśvaryaṣṭakam
analyzed: atha śrī bhuvaneśvarī aṣṭakam
translated: Now, the eight verses on Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: śrīdevyuvāca
analyzed: śrī devī uvāca
translated: Shri Devi said:

original: prabho śrībhairavaśreṣṭha dayālo bhaktavatsala /
analyzed: prabho śrī bhairava śreṣṭha dayālo bhakta vatsala
translated: O Lord, best of Shri Bhairava, compassionate, affectionate towards devotees,

analyzed: bhuvaneśī stavam brūhi yadi aham tava vallabhā
translated: Tell me the praise of Bhuvaneshvari, if I am your beloved.

original: īśvara uvāca
analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Ishvara said:

original: śṛṇu devi / pravakṣyāmi bhuvaneśyaṣṭakaṃ śubham /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi bhuvaneśī aṣṭakam śubham
translated: Listen, O Goddess, I will tell you the auspicious eight verses on Bhuvaneshvari,

analyzed: yena vijñāta mātreṇa trailokya maṅgalam bhavet
translated: By merely knowing which, one becomes the auspicious of the three worlds.

original: oṃ namāmi jagadādhārāṃ bhuvaneśīṃ bhavapriyām /
analyzed: om namāmi jagat ādhārām bhuvaneśīm bhavapriyām
translated: Om, I bow to Bhuvaneshvari, the support of the world, who loves existence.

analyzed: bhukti mukti pradām ramyām ramaṇīyām śubha āvahām

analyzed: tvam svāhā tvam svadhā devi tvam yajñā yajñanāyikā

translated: You are the protector, you are the remover of darkness, devoid of the pervaded and the pervader.

analyzed: tvam ādhāraḥ tvam ijyā ca jñāna jñeyam param padam
translated: You are the support, you are the worship, the knowledge, the object of knowledge, the supreme state,

original: tvaṃ śivastvaṃ svayaṃ viṣṇustvamātmā paramo'vyayaḥ // //🔽tvaṃ kāraṇañca kāryañca lakṣmīstvañca hutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: tvam śivaḥ tvam svayam viṣṇuḥ tvam ātmā paramaḥ vyayaḥ  tvam kāraṇam ca kāryam ca lakṣmīḥ tvam ca hutāśanaḥ
translated: You are Śiva, you are Viṣṇu yourself, you are the supreme, imperishable Self.🔽You are the cause and the effect, you are Lakṣmī and the sacrificial fire,

original: tvaṃ somastvaṃ raviḥ kālastvaṃ dhātā tvañca mārutaḥ // //
analyzed: tvam somaḥ tvam raviḥ kālaḥ tvam dhātā tvam ca mārutaḥ
translated: You are the moon, you are the sun, you are time, you are the creator, and you are the wind.

original: gāyatrī tvaṃ ca sāvitrī tvaṃ māyā tvaṃ haripriyā /
analyzed: gāyatrī tvam ca sāvitrī tvam māyā tvam hari priyā
translated: You are Gāyatrī, you are Sāvitrī, you are Māyā, you are dear to Hari,

original: tvamevaikā parāśaktistvameva gururūpadhṛk // //
analyzed: tvam eva ekā parāśaktiḥ tvam eva guru rūpadhṛk
translated: You alone are the supreme Śakti, you alone assume the form of the Guru.

original: tvaṃ kālā tvaṃ kalā'tītā tvameva jagatāṃśriyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam kālā tvam kalā atītā tvam eva jagatām śriyaḥ
translated: You are Kāla, you are beyond Kalā, you alone are the glory of the worlds,

original: tvaṃ sarvakāryaṃ sarvasya kāraṇaṃ karuṇāmayi / // //
analyzed: tvam sarva kāryam sarvasya kāraṇam karuṇā mayi
translated: You are all actions, you are the cause of everything, O Compassionate One.

original: idamaṣṭakamādyāyā bhuvaneśyā varānane /
analyzed: idam aṣṭakam ādyāyāḥ bhuvaneśyāḥ varānane
translated: This set of eight, O beautiful one, is of the primordial Bhuvaneśī,

original: trisandhyaṃ śraddhayā martyo yaḥ paṭhet prītamānasaḥ // //
analyzed: trisandhyam śraddhayā martyaḥ yaḥ paṭhet prīta mānasaḥ
translated: A mortal who recites this with faith and a delighted mind at the three junctions of the day,

original: siddhayo vaśagāstasya sampado vaśagā gṛhe /
analyzed: siddhayaḥ vaśa gāḥ tasya sampadaḥ vaśa gāḥ gṛhe
translated: The accomplishments are under his control, and wealth is under his control in the house.

original: rājāno vaśamāyānti stotrasyā'sya prabhāvataḥ // //🔽p /
analyzed: rājānaḥ vaśam āyānti stotrasya asya prabhāvataḥ  p
translated: By the power of this hymn, kings come under control.

original: bhūtapretapiśācādyā nekṣante tāṃ diśaṃ grahāḥ /
analyzed: bhūta preta piśāca ādyāḥ na īkṣante tām diśam grahāḥ
translated: Evil spirits, ghosts, demons, and other such beings, as well as planets, do not look towards that direction.

original: yaṃ yaṃ kāmaṃ pravāñcheta sādhakaḥ prītamānasaḥ // //
analyzed: yam yam kāmam pravāñcheta sādhakaḥ prīta mānasaḥ
translated: Whatever desire the practitioner may wish for, with a pleased mind,

original: taṃ tamāpnoti kṛpayā bhuvaneśyā varānane / /
analyzed: tam tam āpnoti kṛpayā bhuvaneśyāḥ varānane
translated: he attains it through the grace of Bhuvaneśī, O beautiful-faced one.

original: anena sadṛśaṃ stotraṃ na samaṃ bhuvanatraye // //
analyzed: anena sadṛśam stotram na samam bhuvanatraye  /
translated: There is no hymn equal to this in the three worlds.

original: sarvasampatpradamidaṃ stotraṃ pāvanānāñca pāvanam /
analyzed: sarva sampad pradam idam stotram pāvanānām ca pāvanam
translated: This hymn grants all prosperity and is the most purifying of all purifying things.

original: anena stotravaryeṇa sādhitena varānane / /
analyzed: anena stotra varyeṇa sādhitena varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, by accomplishing this excellent hymn,

original: sampado vaśamāyānti bhuvaneśyāḥ prasādataḥ // //
analyzed: sampadaḥ vaśam āyānti bhuvaneśyāḥ prasādataḥ
translated: prosperity comes under control through the grace of Bhuvaneśī.

original: iti śrīrudrayāmale tantre śrībhuvaneśvaryaṣṭakaṃ sampūrṇam /
analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmale tantre śrī bhuvaneśvarī aṣṭakam sampūrṇam
translated: Thus ends the eight verses of Shri Bhuvaneśvarī in the Rudra Yamala Tantra.

original: saṃvat phālguna vadi guruvāraḥ //
analyzed: saṃvat phālguna vadi guruvāraḥ
translated: The year is Phālguna, the day is Thursday.

original: atha śrībhuvaneśvaryā bhakarādisahasranāma stotram
analyzed: atha śrī bhuvaneśvaryāḥ bhakara ādi sahasra nāma stotram
translated: Now, the thousand names of Shri Bhuvaneśvarī, the hymn of praise for her devotees and others.

original: oṃ asya śrībhuvaneśvarīsahasranāmastotramaṃtrasyasadāśiva ṛṣiḥ anuṣṭup
analyzed: om asya śrī bhuvaneśvarī sahasranāma stotra maṃtrasya sadāśivaḥ ṛṣiḥ anuṣṭubh
translated: Om, of this hymn of the thousand names of Shri Bhuvaneśvarī, the sage is Sadāśiva, the meter is Anuṣṭup,

original: chaṃdaḥ bhuvaneśvarī devatā lajjā bījam kamalā śaktiḥ vāgbhavaṃ kīlakam
analyzed: chaṃdaḥ bhuvaneśvarī devatā lajjā bījam kamalā śaktiḥ vāc bhavam kīlakam
translated: the deity is Bhuvaneśvarī, the seed is lajjā, the power is kamalā, and the kīlaka is vām.

original: sarvārthasādhane pāṭhe viniyogaḥ //
analyzed: sarva artha sādhane pāṭhe viniyogaḥ
translated: The application is in the recitation for accomplishing all purposes.

original: oṃ bhuvaneśī bhuvārādhyā bhavānī bhayanāśinī /
analyzed: om bhuvaneśī bhuva ārādhyā bhavānī bhaya nāśinī
translated: Om. Bhuvaneśī (Goddess of the Universe), worshipped by the people, Bhavani (Born from Bhava), destroyer of fear,

original: bhavarūpā bhavānandā bhavasāgaratāriṇī // //
translated: Having the form of existence, bliss of existence, savior from the ocean of worldly existence.

original: bhavodbhavā bhavaratā bhavabhāranivāriṇī /🔽bhavyāsyā bhavyanayanā bhavyarūpā bhavauṣadhiḥ // //
translated: Originating from existence, devoted to existence, remover of the burden of worldly existence,🔽Having a beautiful face, beautiful eyes, having a beautiful form, the medicine for worldly existence.

original: bhavyāṅganā bhavyakeśī bhavapāśavimocinī /
translated: A beautiful woman, having beautiful hair, liberator from the noose of worldly existence,

original: bhavyāsanā bhavyavastrā bhavyābharaṇabhūṣitā // //🔽bhagarūpā bhagānandā bhageśī bhagamālinī /
analyzed: bhavya āsanā bhavya vastrā bhavya ābharaṇa bhūṣitā
translated: Seated on a beautiful seat, wearing beautiful garments, adorned with beautiful ornaments,🔽Having the form of Bhaga (fortune), blissful with Bhaga, the mistress of Bhaga, having a garland of Bhaga,

original: bhagavidyā bhagavatī bhagaklinā bhagāvahā // //🔽bhagāṅkarā bhagakriḍā bhagāḍhyā bhagamaṅgalā /
translated: Knowing the secret, the revered one, smeared with Bhaga, bringing Bhaga,🔽Causing Bhaga, playing with Bhaga, endowed with Bhaga, auspicious with Bhaga,

original: bhagalīlā bhagaprītā bhagasampadbhageśvarī // //🔽bhagālayā bhagotsāhā bhagasthā bhagapoṣiṇī /
translated: Engaged in the sports of Bhaga, delighted with Bhaga, having the prosperity of Bhaga, the mistress of Bhaga,🔽The abode of Bhaga, enthusiastic about Bhaga, abiding in Bhaga, nourishing Bhaga,

original: bhagotsavā bhagavidyā bhagamātā bhagasthitā // //🔽bhagaśaktirbhaganidhirbhagapūjā bhageṣaṇā /
translated: Having the festivals of Bhaga, having the knowledge of Bhaga, the mother of Bhaga, abiding in Bhaga,🔽The power of Bhaga, the treasure of Bhaga, the worship of Bhaga, the search for Bhaga,

original: bhagasvāpā bhagādhiśā bhagārcyā bhagasundarī // //
translated: Sleeping in Bhaga, the overseer of Bhaga, to be worshipped with Bhaga, beautiful with Bhaga.

original: bhagarekhā bhagasnehā bhagasnehavivardhinī /
translated: The line of the vulva, the affection of the vulva, the enhancer of the affection of the vulva,

original: bhaginī bhagabījasthā bhagabhogavilāsinī // //
translated: The sister, dwelling in the seed of the vulva, the one who delights in the enjoyment of the vulva,

original: bhagācārā bhagādhārā bhagākārā bhagāśrayā /
analyzed: bhaga ācārā bhaga ādhārā bhaga ākārā bhaga āśrayā
translated: The conduct of the vulva, the support of the vulva, the form of the vulva, the one who relies on the vulva,

original: bhagapuṣpā bhagaśrīpā bhagapuṣpanivāsinī // //
translated: The flower of the vulva, the one who bestows the glory of the vulva, the one who dwells in the vulva flower,

original: bhavyarūpadharā bhavyā bhavyapuṣpairalaṅkṛtā /
analyzed: bhavya rūpa dharā bhavyā bhavya puṣpaiḥ alaṅkṛtā
translated: The bearer of a beautiful form, the beautiful one, adorned with beautiful flowers,

original: bhavyalīlā bhavyamālā bhavyāṅgi bhavyasundarī // //🔽p / 🔽bhavyaśīlā bhavyalīlā bhavyākṣī bhavyanāśinī /
analyzed: p
translated: The beautiful play, the beautiful garland, the beautiful-limbed one, the beautiful and lovely one,🔽The beautiful conduct, the beautiful play, the beautiful-eyed one, the destroyer of the beautiful,

original: bhavyāṅgikā bhavyavāṇī bhavyakāntirbhagālinī // //
translated: The beautiful-limbed one, the beautiful-voiced one, the beautiful-lustred one, the one with a beautiful vulva,

original: bhavyatrapā bhavyanadī bhavyabhogavihāriṇī /🔽bhavyastanī bhavyamukhī bhavyagoṣṭhī bhayāpahā // //🔽bhakteśvarī bhaktikarī bhaktānugrahakāriṇī /
translated: The beautiful modesty, the beautiful river, the one who sports in beautiful enjoyments,🔽The beautiful-breasted one, the beautiful-faced one, the beautiful assembly, the remover of fear,🔽The queen of devotion, the one who inspires devotion, the one who bestows grace on devotees,

original: bhaktidā bhaktijananī bhaktānandavivarddhinī // //🔽bhaktipriyā bhaktiratā bhaktibhāvavihāriṇī /
translated: The giver of devotion, the mother of devotion, the enhancer of the bliss of devotees,🔽The beloved of devotion, devoted to devotion, the one who sports in the sentiment of devotion,

original: bhaktiśīlā bhaktilīlā bhakteśā bhaktipālinī // //
translated: The one with the conduct of devotion, the play of devotion, the lord of devotees, the protector of devotion,

original: bhaktividyā bhaktavidyā bhaktirbhaktivinodinī /
translated: The knowledge of devotion, the knowledge of the devotee, devotion, the one who delights in devotion,

original: bhaktirītirbhaktiprītirbhaktisādhanasādhinī // //🔽bhaktisādhyā bhaktasādhyā bhaktirālī bhaveśvarī /
translated: The path of devotion, the love of devotion, the means and accomplishment of devotion,🔽The object of devotion, the means of devotion, the garland of devotion, the goddess of devotion,

original: bhaṭavidyā bhaṭānandā bhaṭasthā bhaṭarūpiṇī // //
translated: The knowledge of the warrior, the joy of the warrior, abiding in the warrior, having the form of the warrior,

original: bhaṭamānyā bhaṭasthānyā bhaṭasthānanivāsinī /🔽bhaṭinī bhaṭarūpeśī bhaṭarūpavivarddhinī // //🔽bhaṭaveśī bhaṭeśī ca bhaṭabhāgbhavasundarī /
analyzed: bhaṭamānyā bhaṭasthānyā bhaṭasthānanivāsinī
translated: Honored by the warriors, abiding in the abode of the warriors, dwelling in the abode of the warriors,🔽A female warrior, the lord of the form of the warrior, the enhancer of the form of the warrior,🔽Having the attire of a warrior, the queen of warriors, the beautiful one who bestows the share of warriors,

original: bhaṭaprītyā bhaṭarītyā bhaṭānugrahakāriṇī // //🔽bhaṭārādhyā bhaṭabodhyā bhaṭabodhavinodinī /
translated: Out of love for the warriors, out of the love for the warriors, the one who bestows grace upon the warriors,🔽To be worshipped by the warriors, to be awakened by the warriors, the one who delights in awakening the warriors,

original: bhaṭaiḥ sevyā bhaṭavarā bhaṭārcyā bhaṭabodhinī // //🔽bhaṭakīrtyā bhaṭakalā bhaṭapā bhaṭapālinī /🔽bhaṭaiśvaryyā bhaṭādhīśā bhaṭekṣā bhaṭatoṣiṇī // //
translated: To be served by the warriors, the best of warriors, to be worshipped by the warriors, the one who enlightens the warriors,🔽The fame of the warriors, the art of the warriors, the protector of the warriors, the guardian of the warriors,🔽The sovereignty of the warriors, the lord of the minds of warriors, the one who is looked upon by the warriors, the one who delights the warriors,

original: bhaṭeśī bhaṭajananī bhaṭabhāgyavivarddhinī /🔽bhaṭabhuktirbhaṭayuktirbhaṭaprītivivarddhinī // //
translated: The queen of warriors, the mother of warriors, the enhancer of the fortune of warriors,🔽The enjoyment of warriors, the strategy of warriors, the enhancer of the love of warriors,

original: bhāgyeśī bhāgyajananī bhāgyasthā bhāgyarūpiṇī /
translated: The goddess of fortune, the mother of fortune, abiding in fortune, having the form of fortune,

original: bhāvanā bhāvakuśalā bhāvadā bhāvavarddhinī // //🔽bhāvarūpā bhāvarasā bhavāntaravihāriṇī /
translated: She is the meditation, skilled in meditation, the bestower of meditation, and the increaser of meditation.🔽She is of the form of meditation, the essence of meditation, and the enjoyer of different states of existence.

original: bhavāṅkarā bhavakalā bhāvasthānanivāsinī // //
translated: She is the source of worldly existence, the digit of worldly existence, and the resident of the abode of worldly existence.

original: bhāvāntarā bhāvadhṛtā bhāvamadhyavyavasthitā /
analyzed: bhāva antarā bhāva dhṛtā bhāva madhya vyavasthitā
translated: She is beyond worldly existence, sustained by worldly existence, and situated in the middle of worldly existence.

original: bhāvaṛddhirbhāvasiddhirbhāvādirbhāvabhāvinī // //🔽p /
analyzed: p
translated: She is the prosperity of worldly existence, the accomplishment of worldly existence, the beginning of worldly existence, and the creator of worldly existence.

original: bhāvālayā bhāvaparā bhāvasādhanatatparā /🔽bhāveśvarī bhāvagamyā bhāvasthā bhāvagarvitā // //
translated: She is the abode of worldly existence, devoted to worldly existence, and intent on the means of accomplishing worldly existence.🔽She is the mistress of worldly existence, to be attained through worldly existence, abiding in worldly existence, and proud in worldly existence.

original: bhāvinī bhāvaramaṇī bhāratī bhārateśvarī /🔽bhāgīrathī bhhagyavatī bhāgyodayakarī kalā // //
translated: She is the future, the beloved of worldly existence, Sarasvati, the goddess of speech, and the goddess of the Bharata (epic).🔽She is the Bhagirathi, blessed with good fortune, and the art that brings about the rise of good fortune.

original: bhāgyāśrayā bhāgyamayī bhāgyā bhāgyaphalapradā /🔽bhāgyācārā bhāgyasārā bhāgyadhārā ca bhāgyadā // //🔽bhāgyeśvarī bhāgyanidhirbhāgyā bhāgyasumātṛkā /
analyzed: bhāgya ācārā bhāgya sārā bhāgya dhārā ca bhāgya dā  /
translated: She is the resort of good fortune, full of good fortune, the portion of good fortune, and the bestower of the fruits of good fortune.🔽She is of the conduct of good fortune, the essence of good fortune, the stream of good fortune, and the giver of good fortune.🔽She is the mistress of good fortune, the treasure of good fortune, the portion of good fortune, and the mother of good fortune.

original: bhāgyekṣā bhāgyanā bhāgyabhāgyadā bhāgyamātṛkā // //
translated: She is the desire for good fortune, the mind of good fortune, the beginning of good fortune, and the one situated in the middle of good fortune.

original: bhāgyekṣā bhāgyamanasā bhāgyādirbhāgyamadhyagā /
analyzed: bhāgya īkṣā bhāgya manasā bhāgya ādiḥ bhāgya madhya gā
translated: She is the desire for good fortune, the mind of good fortune, and the one situated in the middle of good fortune.

original: bhrātrīsvarī bhrātṛmatī bhrātrambā bhrātṛpālinī // //
translated: Sister of the brothers, having brothers, sister of the brothers, protector of the brothers,

original: bhrātṛsthā bhrātṛkuśalā bhrāmarī bhramarāmbikā /🔽bhillarūpā bhillavatī bhillasthā bhillapālinī // //
analyzed: bhilla rūpā bhillavatī bhilla sthā bhilla pālinī  /
translated: Stationed with the brothers, skilled in the brothers, buzzing, having the bees as mother,🔽Having the form of a hunter, having the hunters, stationed in the hunters, protector of the hunters,

original: bhillamātā bhilladhātrī bhillinī bhillakeśvarī /🔽bhillakīrtirbhillakalā bhillamandaravāsinī // //
translated: Mother of the hunters, nurse of the hunters, a hunter, the goddess of the hunters,🔽Having the fame of the hunters, having the arts of the hunters, residing on the Mandara mountain of the hunters,

original: bhillakrīḍā bhillalīlā bhillārcyā bhillavallabhā /🔽bhillasnuṣā bhillaputrī bhillinī bhillapoṣiṇī // //🔽bhillapautrī bhillagoṣṭhī bhillacāranivāsinī /
translated: Playing with the hunters, sporting with the hunters, worshipped by the hunters, beloved of the hunters,🔽Daughter-in-law of the hunters, daughter of the hunters, a hunter, nourishing the hunters,🔽Granddaughter of the hunters, assembly of the hunters, residing in the conduct of the hunters,

original: bhillapūjyā bhillavāṇī bhillāṇī bhillabhītihā // //🔽bhītasthā bhītajananī bhītirbhītivināśinī /
translated: Worthy of worship by the hunters, speech of the hunters, a hunter, dispelling the fear of the hunters,🔽Stationed in fear, mother of the fearful, fear, destroyer of fear,

original: bhītidā bhītihā bhītyā bhītyākāravihāriṇī // //🔽bhīteśī bhītiśamanī bhītisthānanivāsinī /🔽bhītirītyā bhītikalā bhītīkṣā bhītihāriṇī // //
analyzed: bhīti dā bhīti hā bhītyā bhīti ākāra vihāriṇī
translated: Bestower of fear, remover of fear, sporting in the form of fear,🔽Mistress of fear, alleviator of fear, residing in the abode of fear,🔽Having the gait of fear, the art of fear, the austerity of fear, removing fear,

original: bhīmeśī bhīmajananī bhīmā bhīmanivāsinī /
translated: Mistress of the terrible, mother of the terrible, terrible, residing in the terrible,

original: bhīmeśvarī bhīmaratā bhīmāṅgī bhīmapālinī // //🔽bhīmanādā bhīmatantrī bhīmaiśvaryyavivarddhinī /
translated: She is the controller of the terrible, she is devoted to the terrible, she has a terrible form, she is the protector of the terrible.🔽She is the one with a terrible roar, she is the one with terrible strings, she is the one who increases terrible lordship.

original: bhīmagoṣṭhī bhīmadhātrī bhīmavidyāvinodinī // //
translated: She is the terrible assembly, she is the terrible nurse, she is the one who delights in terrible knowledge.

original: bhīmavikramadātrī ca bhīmavikramavāsinī /
translated: She is the giver of terrible valor, she is the one who resides in terrible valor.

original: bhīmānandakarī devī bhīmānandavihāriṇī // //🔽p / 🔽bhīmopadeśinī nityā bhīmabhāgyapradāyinī /
analyzed: p
translated: She is the goddess who brings terrible bliss, she is the one who enjoys terrible bliss.🔽She is the one who always gives terrible advice, she is the one who bestows terrible good fortune.

original: bhīmasiddhirbhīmaṛddhirbhīmabhaktivivarddhinī // //🔽bhīmasthā bhīmavaradā bhīmadharmopadeśinī /
analyzed: bhīma sthā bhīma vara dā bhīma dharma upadeśinī
translated: She is terrible accomplishment, she is terrible prosperity, she is the one who increases terrible devotion.🔽She is the one who resides in the terrible, she is the giver of terrible boons, she is the one who teaches terrible dharma.

original: bhīṣmeśvarī bhīṣmabhṛtirbhiṣmabodhaprabodhinī // //🔽bhīṣmaśrīrbhīṣmajananī bhīṣmajñānopadeśinī /
translated: She is the one who controls the terrible, she is the supporter of the terrible, she is the one who awakens the terrible.🔽She is the glory of the terrible, she is the mother of the terrible, she is the one who teaches terrible knowledge.

original: bhīṣmasthā bhīṣmatapanā bhīṣmeśī bhīṣmatāriṇī // //🔽bhīṣmalīlā bhīṣmaśīlā bhīṣmarodhonivāsinī /🔽bhīṣmāśrayā bhīṣmavarā bhīṣmaharṣavivarddhinī // //
analyzed: bhīṣma līlā bhīṣma śīlā bhīṣma rodhaḥ nivāsinī
translated: She is the one who resides in the terrible, she is the one who burns with the terrible, she is the mistress of the terrible, she is the one who saves from the terrible.🔽She is the play of the terrible, she is the conduct of the terrible, she is the one who resides in the obstruction of the terrible.🔽She is the one who relies on the terrible, she is the best of the terrible, she is the one who increases the delight of the terrible.

original: bhuvanā bhuvaneśānī bhuvanānandakāriṇī /
translated: She is the world, she is the mistress of the world, she is the one who brings joy to the worlds.

original: bhuvisthā bhuvirūpā ca bhuvibhāranivāriṇī // //
analyzed: bhuvisthā bhuvirūpā ca bhuvibhāranivāriṇī
translated: She resides on the earth, she has the form of the earth, she is the one who removes the burden of the earth.

original: bhuktisthā bhuktidā bhuktirbhukteśī bhuktirūpiṇī /
translated: She who enjoys, she who grants enjoyment, she who is enjoyment, she who is in the form of enjoyment,

original: bhukteśvarī bhuktidātrī bhuktirākārarūpiṇī // //
translated: she who is the mistress of enjoyment, she who grants enjoyment, she who is enjoyment in the form of a shape,

original: bhujaṅgasthā bhujaṅgeśī bhujaṅgākārarūpiṇī /🔽bhujaṅgī bhujagāvāsā bhujaṅgānandadāyinī // //
