analyzed: bhūpa ākṛtiḥ bhūpa ratiḥ bhūpa śrīḥ bhūpa śreyasī
translated: Bestowing auspiciousness to kings, a king, a creeper on the earth, a female elephant,🔽Enjoying the pleasures of kings, the splendor of kings, the hope of kings, bestowing auspicious form on kings,🔽Having the form of a king, delighting in kings, the prosperity of kings, the best for kings,

original: bhūpanītirbhūparītirbhūpabhītirbhayaṅkarī /🔽bhavadānandalaharī bhavadānandasundarī // //
translated: The policy of kings, the favor of kings, the fear of kings, the fearful one,🔽The wave of bliss from the Lord, the beautiful one with the bliss of the Lord,

original: bhavadānandakaraṇī bhavadanandavarddhinī /🔽bhavadānandaramaṇī bhavadānandadāyinī // //
translated: The bestower of the bliss of the Lord, the increaser of the joy of the Lord,🔽The delight of the bliss of the Lord, the giver of the bliss of the Lord,

original: bhavadānandajananī bhavadānandarūpiṇī /
translated: The mother of the bliss of the Lord, having the form of the bliss of the Lord,

original: ya idaṃ paṭhate stotraṃ pratyahaṃ bhaktisaṃyutaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ idam paṭhate stotram pratyaham bhakti saṃyutaḥ
translated: One who recites this hymn daily, endowed with devotion,

original: gurubhaktiyuto bhūtvā gurusevāparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: guru bhakti yutaḥ bhūtvā guru sevā parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Having devotion to the guru, devoted to serving the guru,

original: jitendriyaḥ satyavādī tāmbūlapūritānanaḥ // //
analyzed: jita indriyaḥ satya vādī tāmbūla pūrita ānanaḥ
translated: With senses conquered, truthful, and with a mouth filled with betel leaves.

original: divārātrau ca sandhyāyāṃ sa bhavet parameśvaraḥ /
analyzed: divārātrau ca sandhyāyām sa bhavet parameśvaraḥ
translated: Day and night, at dawn and dusk, he becomes the Supreme Lord.

original: stavamātrasya pāṭhena rājā vaśyo bhaved dhruvam // //
analyzed: stava mātrasya pāṭhena rājā vaśyaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: By merely reciting this hymn, the king will certainly be subdued.

original: sarvāgameṣu vijñāni sarvatantre svayaṃ haraḥ /
analyzed: sarva āgameṣu vijñāni sarva tantre svayam haraḥ
translated: In all scriptures, the wise Hara is himself in all Tantras.

original: gurormukhāt samabhyasya sthitvā ca gurusannidhau // //
analyzed: guroḥ mukhāt samabhyasya sthitvā ca guru sannidhau
translated: Having practiced from the mouth of the guru and staying in the presence of the guru,

original: śivasthāneṣu sandhyāyāṃ śūnyāgāre catuṣpathe /
analyzed: śiva sthāneṣu sandhyāyām śūnya āgāre catuṣpathe
translated: In the abodes of Shiva, at dawn, in an empty house, at a crossroads,

original: yaḥ paṭhecchaṛṇuyādvāpi sa yogī nātra saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet śaṛṇuyāt vā api sa yogī na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: He who recites or listens is a yogi, there is no doubt.

original: sarvasvadakṣiṇāṃ dadyātstrīputrādikameva ca /
analyzed: sarva sva dakṣiṇām dadyāt strī putra ādikam eva ca
translated: One should give all one's wealth as a gift, as well as wife, children, and so on.

original: svachandamānaso bhūtvā stavamenaṃ samuddharet // //
analyzed: svachanda mānasaḥ bhūtvā stavam enam samuddharet
translated: Becoming one whose mind is at ease, one should recite this hymn.

original: etatstotrarato devi hararūpo na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: etad stotra rataḥ devi hara rūpaḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O Goddess, one who is devoted to this hymn is undoubtedly of the form of Shiva.

original: yaḥ paṭhecchṛṇuyādvāpi ekacittena sarvadā // //
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet śṛṇuyāt vā api ekacittena sarvadā
translated: He who recites or listens with a single mind at all times,

original: sa dīrghāyuḥ sukhī vāgmī vāṇī tasya na saṃśayaḥ /🔽gurupādarato bhūtvā kāminīnāṃ bhavet priyaḥ // //
analyzed: sa dīrgha āyuḥ sukhī vāgmī vāṇī tasya na saṃśayaḥ  guru pāda rataḥ bhūtvā kāminīnām bhavet priyaḥ
translated: He will be long-lived, happy, eloquent, and his speech will undoubtedly be like that.🔽Becoming devoted to the feet of the guru, he becomes dear to the women.

original: dhanavānguṇavān śrīmān dhīmāniva guruḥ priye /
analyzed: dhanavān guṇavān śrīmān dhīmān iva guruḥ priye
translated: Wealthy, virtuous, prosperous, and wise like the guru, O beloved.

original: sarveṣāṃ tu priyo bhūtvā pūjayet sarvadā stavam // //🔽p /
analyzed: sarveṣām tu priyaḥ bhūtvā pūjayet sarvadā stavam  p
translated: Having become dear to all, one should always worship with praise.

original: maṃtrasiddhiḥ karasthaiva tasya devi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: maṃtra siddhiḥ kara sthā eva tasya devi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The mantra accomplishment is in his hand, O Goddess, there is no doubt.

original: kuberatvaṃ bhavet tasya tasyādhīnā hi siddhayaḥ // //
analyzed: kubera tvam bhavet tasya tasya adhīnāḥ hi siddhayaḥ
translated: He will attain the state of Kubera, for accomplishments are under his control.

original: mṛtaputrā ca yā nārī daurbhāgyaparipīḍitā /
analyzed: mṛta putrā ca yā nārī daurbhāgya paripīḍitā
translated: A woman who has lost a son, afflicted by misfortune,

original: vandhyā vā kākavandhyā vā mṛtavatsā ca yā'ṅganā // //
analyzed: vandhyā vā kākavandhyā vā mṛta vatsā ca yā aṅganā
translated: a barren woman, a woman with a dead child,

original: dhanadhānyavihīnā ca rogaśokākulā ca yā /
analyzed: dhana dhānya vihīnā ca roga śoka ākulā ca yā
translated: a woman devoid of wealth and grain, tormented by disease and grief,

original: tābhiretanmahādevi bhūrjapatre vilikhya vai // //
analyzed: tābhiḥ etat mahādevi bhūrja patre vilikhya vai
translated: O Great Goddess, those women should write this on a birch bark leaf,

original: savye bhuje dhāraṇīyaṃ tena saukhyapradaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: savye bhuje dhāraṇīyam tena saukhya pradam bhavet
translated: and wear it on the right arm. It will bring happiness.

original: evaṃ punaḥ punaryāyādduḥkhena paripīḍitā // //
analyzed: evam punar punar yāyāt duḥkhena paripīḍitā
translated: Thus, afflicted by suffering, she should go again and again.

original: sabhāyāṃ vyasane vāṇīvivāde śatrusaṅkaṭe /
analyzed: sabhāyām vyasane vāṇī vivāde śatru saṅkaṭe
translated: In an assembly, in a calamity, in a debate, in an encounter with enemies,

original: caturaṅge tathā yuddhe sarvatrāpadi pīḍane // //
analyzed: catur aṅge tathā yuddhe sarvatra āpadi pīḍane  /
translated: in a battle with four divisions, everywhere in danger and affliction,

original: smaraṇādasya kalyāṇī saṃśayā yānti dūrataḥ /🔽na deyaṃ paraśiṣyāya nābhaktāya ca durjane // //
analyzed: smaraṇāt asya kalyāṇī saṃśayāḥ yānti dūratas  na deyam para śiṣyāya na abhaktāya ca durjane
translated: by remembering this, all misfortunes go away.🔽This should not be given to the disciple of another, to the faithless, or to the wicked.

original: dāmbhikāya kuśīlāya kṛpaṇāya sureśvarī /
analyzed: dāmbhikāya kuśīlāya kṛpaṇāya sureśvarī
translated: O Goddess of the gods, to the hypocrite, to the immoral, to the miser,

original: dadyācchiṣyāya śāntāya vinītāya jitātmane // //
analyzed: dadyāt śiṣyāya śāntāya vinītāya jita ātmane
translated: Should be given to a peaceful, humble, self-controlled disciple,

original: bhaktāya śāntiyuktāya rajaḥpūjāratāya ca /🔽janmāntarasahasraistu varṇituṃ naiva śakyate // //
analyzed: bhaktāya śānti yuktāya rajaḥ pūjā ratāya ca  janma antara sahasraiḥ tu varṇitum nā eva śakyate
translated: To a devotee endowed with peace, and one devoted to the worship of Rajas.🔽Even in thousands of lifetimes, it cannot be described,

original: stavamātrasya māhātmyaṃ vaktrakoṭiśatairapi /
analyzed: stava mātrasya māhātmyam vaktra koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Even in hundreds of thousands of mouths, the greatness of this mere praise,

original: viṣṇave kathitaṃ pūrvaṃ brahmaṇāpi priyaṃvade // //
analyzed: viṣṇave kathitam pūrvam brahmaṇā api priyaṃvade
translated: Was formerly told to Vishnu by Brahma himself, O sweet-voiced one.

original: adhunāpi tava snehāt kathitaṃ parameśvari /
analyzed: adhunā api tava snehāt kathitam parameśvari
translated: Now also, out of affection for you, O Supreme Goddess, it has been told,

original: gopitavyaṃ paśubhyaśca sarvathā na prakāśayet // //
analyzed: gopitavyam paśubhyaḥ ca sarvathā na prakāśayet
translated: It should be kept secret from the animals, and should never be revealed to anyone.

original: iti mahātantrārṇave īśvarapārvatīsaṃvādebhuvaneśvarībhakārādisahasranāma
analyzed: iti mahātantra arṇave īśvara pārvatī saṃvāde bhuvaneśvarī bhakāra ādi sahasranāma
translated: Thus ends the thousand names of Bhuvaneshvari beginning with Bhu, in the great Tantra scripture of the dialogue between Ishvara and Parvati.

original: stotraṃ samāptam /
analyzed: stotram samāptam
translated: The hymn to Bhuvaneshvari is complete.

original: śrībhuvaneśvarīhṛdayastotram
translated: The Hymn to the Heart of Shri Bhuvaneshvari

original: śrīdevyuvāca
analyzed: śrī devī uvāca
translated: Shri Devi said:

original: bhagavan brūhi tatstotraṃ sarvakāmaprasādhanam /
analyzed: bhagavan brūhi tat stotram sarva kāma prasādhanam
translated: O Lord, please tell me that hymn which fulfills all desires,

original: yasya śravaṇamātreṇa nānyacchrotavyamiṣyate // //
analyzed: yasya śravaṇa mātreṇa na anyat śrotavyam iṣyate  /
translated: By merely hearing which, nothing else is considered to be worth listening to.

original: yadi me'nugrahaḥ kāryaḥ prītiścāpi mamopari /
analyzed: yadi menu grahaḥ kāryaḥ prītiḥ ca api mama upari
translated: If you wish to bestow grace upon me and show affection towards me,

original: tadidaṃ kathaya brahman vimalaṃ yanmahītale // //
analyzed: tat idam kathaya brahman vimalam yat mahī tale
translated: Then please tell me this pure hymn, O Brahmin, which is famous on earth.

original: īśvara uvāca
analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Ishvara said:

original: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi sarvakāmaprasādhanam /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi pravakṣyāmi sarva kāma prasādhanam
translated: Listen, O Goddess, I shall tell you the means of fulfilling all desires,

original: hṛdayaṃ bhuvaneśvaryāḥ stotramasti yaśaḥpradam // //
analyzed: hṛdayam bhuvaneśvaryāḥ stotram asti yaśaḥ pradam
translated: There is a hymn to the heart of Bhuvaneśvarī which bestows fame.

original: oṃ asya śrībhuvaneśvarīhṛdayastotramaṃtrasya śaktirṛṣiḥ gāyatrī
analyzed: om asya śrī bhuvaneśvarī hṛdaya stotra maṃtrasya śaktiḥ ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī
translated: Om, of this hymn of the heart of Śrī Bhuvaneśvarī, Śakti is the sage, Gāyatrī

original: chandaḥ bhuvaneśvarī devatā hakāro bījam īkāraḥ śaktiḥ rephaḥ khīlakam
analyzed: chandaḥ bhuvaneśvarī devatā hakāraḥ bījam īkāraḥ śaktiḥ rephaḥ khīlakam
translated: is the meter, Bhuvaneśvarī is the deity, the letter 'ha' is the seed, the letter 'ī' is the power, and the letter 'ra' is the kīlaka.

original: sakalamanovāñchitasiddhyarthe pāṭhe viniyogaḥ //
analyzed: sakala manaḥ vāñchita siddhi arthe pāṭhe viniyogaḥ
translated: It is employed in the recitation for the accomplishment of all desired things of the mind.

original: oṃ hrīṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ oṃ śrīṃ śirase svāha oṃ aiṃ śikhāyai vaṣaṭ
analyzed: om hrīṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ om śrīṃ śirase svāhā om aim śikhāyai vaṣaṭ
translated: Om hrīṃ, salutations to the heart. Om śrīṃ, svāhā to the head. Om aiṃ, vaṣaṭ to the tuft.

original: oṃ hrīṃ kavacāya huṃ oṃ śrīṃ netratrayāya vauṣaṭ oṃ aiṃ astrāya phaṭ / iti
analyzed: om   kavacāya hum  om śrīṃ netratrayāya vauṣaṭ om aim astrāya phaṭ iti
translated: Om hrīṃ, huṃ to the armor. Om śrīṃ, vauṣaṭ to the three eyes. Om aiṃ, phaṭ to the weapon. Thus

original: hṛdyādiṣaḍaṅganyāsaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdya ādi ṣaṣ aṅganyāsaḥ
translated: is the assignment of the six limbs beginning with the heart.

original: oṃ hrīṃ aṃguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ oṃ śrīṃ tarjanībhyāṃ namaḥ oṃ aiṃ
analyzed: om   aṅguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ om śrīṃ tarjanībhyām namaḥ om aim
translated: Om hrīṃ, salutations to the thumbs. Om śrīṃ, salutations to the index fingers. Om aiṃ

original: madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ oṃ hrīṃ anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ oṃ śrīṃ
analyzed: madhyamābhyām namaḥ om hrīṃ anāmikābhyām namaḥ om śrīṃ
translated: salutations to the middle fingers. Om hrīṃ, salutations to the ring fingers. Om śrīṃ

original: kaniṣṭhikābhyāṃ namaḥ oṃ aiṃ karatalakarapṛṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ / iti
analyzed: kaniṣṭhikābhyām namaḥ om aim kara tala kara pṛṣṭhābhyām namaḥ    iti
translated: salutations to the little fingers. Om aiṃ, salutations to the palms and backs of the hands. Thus

original: karanyāsaḥ //
analyzed: karanyāsaḥ
translated: is the assignment of the hands.

original: atha dhyānam
analyzed: atha dhyānam
translated: Now, the meditation:

original: dhyāyed brahmādikānāṃ kṛtajanijananīṃ yoginīṃ yogayoniṃ
analyzed: dhyāyet brahma ādikānām kṛta jani jananīm yoginīm yoga yonim
translated: One should meditate on the mother who gives birth to Brahma and others, the yogini, the source of yoga,

original: devānāṃ jīvanāyojjvalitajayaparajyotirugrāṅgadhātrīm /
analyzed: devānām jīvanāya ujjvalita jaya para jyotiḥ ugra aṅga dhātrīm
translated: One should meditate on the mother of Brahma and others, the source of yoga, the mother of the fierce limbs that shine for the life of the gods and for the victory of the bright light.

original: śaṃkhaṃ cakraṃ ca bāṇaṃ dhanurapi dadhatīṃ doścatuṣkāmbujātai
analyzed: śaṃkham cakram ca bāṇam dhanuḥ api dadhatīm dos catuṣka ambu jātaiḥ
translated: Holding the conch, discus, arrow, and bow in her four hands,

original: rmāyāmādyāṃ viśiṣṭāṃ bhavabhavabuvanāṃ bhūbhuvābhārabhūmim // //
analyzed: rmāyām ādyām viśiṣṭām bhava bhava buvanām bhūbhuvā ābhāra bhūmim
translated: I bow to the primordial, distinguished, and supreme goddess, the mother of the worlds, the bearer of the burden of the earth.

original: yadājñayedaṃ gaganādyaśeṣaṃ sṛjatyajaḥ śrīpatiraurasaṃ vā /
analyzed: yad ājñayā idam gagana ādi aśeṣam sṛjati ajaḥ śrīpatiḥ aurasam vā
translated: By whose command, the unborn Lord, the master of Shri, creates this entire universe, including the sky, or the fire,

original: bibharti saṃharti bhavastadante bhajāmahe śribhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //🔽jagajjanānandakarīṃ jayākhyāṃ yaśasvinīṃ yaṃtrasuyajñayonim /
analyzed: bibharti saṃharti bhavaḥ tad ante bhajāmahe śri bhuvaneśvarīm tām  jagat jana ānanda karīm jayā ākhyām yaśasvinīm yaṃtra suyajña yonim
translated: And at the end, he sustains and destroys it. I worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: jitāmitāmitrakṛtaprapañcāṃ bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: jita amita amitra kṛta prapañcām bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: I bow to that Shri Bhuvaneshvari, known as Jaya, who brings joy to the people of the world, who is famous, the source of the excellent sacrifice of the yantra,

original: harau prasupte bhuvanatrayānte avātarannābhijapadmajanmā /
analyzed: harau prasupte bhuvana traya ante avātarat nābhi ja padmajanmā
translated: Who has conquered and subdued the enemies, and has created the universe.🔽When Hari was asleep at the end of the three worlds, the lotus-born one descended from his navel.

original: vidhistato'ndhe vidadhāra yatpadaṃ bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: vidhiḥ tatas undhe vidadhāra yat padam bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: Then, when the world was blind, I worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari, whose foot he held.

original: na vidyate kvāpi tu janma yasyā na vā sthitiḥ sāntatikīha yasyāḥ /
analyzed: na vidyate kvāpi tu janma yasyāḥ na vā sthitiḥ sāntatikī iha yasyāḥ
translated: She who has no birth anywhere, nor any temporary existence here,

original: na vā nirodhe'khilakarmma yasyā bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: na vā nirodha ikhila karmma yasyāḥ bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: We worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari, in whom all actions cease.

original: kaṭākṣamokṣācaraṇogravittā niveśitārṇā karuṇārdracittā /
analyzed: kaṭākṣa mokṣa ācaraṇa ugra vittā niveśita arṇā karuṇā ārdra cittā
translated: Whose sidelong glances are the means of liberation, whose feet are the means of wealth, whose mind is moist with compassion,

original: subhaktaye eti samīpsitaṃ yā bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //🔽p /
analyzed: su bhaktaye eti samīpsitam yāḥ bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām  p
translated: Who comes near for the good of her devotees, to grant what is desired, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: yato jagajjanma babhūva yonestadeva madhye pratipāti yā vā /
analyzed: yatas jagat janma babhūva yoneḥ tat eva madhye pratipāti yā vā
translated: From whom the world was born, in whom she places it in the middle,

original: tadatti yā'nte'khilamugrakālī bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: tat atti bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: Who devours it all in the end, the fierce Kali, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: suṣuptikāle janamadhyayantyā yayā janaḥ svapnamavaiti kiñcit /
analyzed: suṣupti kāle janam adhyayantyā yayā janaḥ svapnam avaiti kiñcid
translated: By whom, sleeping in the midst of people at the time of deep sleep, people have some kind of dream,

original: prabudhyate jāgrati jīva eṣa bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: prabudhyate jāgrati jīvaḥ eṣa bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: When awakened, this living being becomes awake, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: dayāsphuratkorakaṭākṣalābhānnaikatra yasyāḥ pralabhanti siddhāḥ /
analyzed: dayā sphurat kora kaṭākṣa lābhāt nā ekatra yasyāḥ pralabhanti siddhāḥ
translated: The Siddhas do not obtain in one place the poetic ability and lordship that come from the sidelong glances of her, whose sidelong glances throb with compassion,

original: kavitvamīśitvamapi svataṃtrā bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: kavi tvam īśi tvam api svataṃtrāḥ bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: Being independent, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshvari.

original: lasanmukhāmbhoruhamutsphuraṃtaṃ hṛdi praṇidhyāya diśi sphuraṃtaḥ /
analyzed: lasat mukha ambhoruham utsphuraṃtam hṛdi praṇidhyāya diśi sphuraṃtaḥ
translated: Meditating in the heart on the radiant lotus face, shining in all directions,

original: yasyāḥ kṛpārdraṃ pravikāśayaṃti bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: yasyāḥ kṛpā ārdram pravikāśayanti bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: We worship that Shri Bhuvaneshwari, whose compassion and grace are manifested,

original: yadānurāgānugatālicitrāściraṃtanapremapariplutāṅgāḥ /
analyzed: yadā anurāga anugata ali citrāḥ ciraṃtana prema paripluta aṅgāḥ
translated: Whose attendants, filled with long-standing love, are adorned with beautiful garlands of affection,

original: sunirbhayāḥ santi pramudya yasyāḥ bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: su nirbhayāḥ santi pramudya yasyāḥ bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: And who are fearless and joyful, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshwari.

original: harirvirañcirhara īśitāraḥ puro'vatiṣṭhaṃti prapannabhaṅgāḥ /
analyzed: hariḥ virañciḥ haraḥ īśitāraḥ puras vatiṣṭhanti prapanna bhaṅgāḥ
translated: Hari, Brahma, Shiva and other lords stand before her, ready to grant protection to those who surrender to her,

original: yasyāḥ samicchanti sadānukūlyaṃ bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: yasyāḥ samicchanti sadā ānukūlyam bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: And always seek her favor, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshwari.

original: manuṃ yadīyaṃ haramagnisaṃsthaṃ tataśca vāmaśruticandrasaktam /
analyzed: manum yadi iyam haram agni saṃstham tatas ca vāma śruti candra saktam
translated: Those who recite the mantra that has Hari in the fire, then connected to the left ear and the moon,

original: japanti ye syurhi suvaṃditāste bhajāmahe śrībhuvaneśvarīṃ tām // //
analyzed: japanti ye syuḥ hi su vaṃditāḥ te bhajāmahe śrī bhuvaneśvarīm tām
translated: Are greatly honored, we worship that Shri Bhuvaneshwari.

original: prasīdatu premarasārdracittā sadā hi sā śrībhuvaneśvarī me /
analyzed: prasīdatu prema rasa ārdra cittā sadā hi sā śrī bhuvaneśvarī me
translated: May that Shri Bhuvaneshwari, whose mind is moist with the nectar of love, always be gracious to me,

original: kṛpākaṭākṣeṇa kuberakalpā bhavaṃti yasyāḥ padabhaktibhājaḥ // //
analyzed: kṛpā kaṭākṣeṇa kubera kalpāḥ bhavanti yasyāḥ pada bhakti bhājaḥ
translated: By whose compassionate glance, those who are devoted to her feet become like Kubera.

original: mudā supāṭhyaṃ bhuvaneśvarīyaṃ sadā satāṃ stotramidaṃ susevyam /
analyzed: mudā su pāṭhyam bhuvaneśvarīyam sadā satām stotram idam su sevyam
translated: This praise of Bhuvaneshwari should be joyfully recited, and this praise of the virtuous should always be well-served,

original: sukhapradaṃ syātkalikalmaṣaghnam suśṛṇvatāṃ saṃpaṭhatāṃ praśasyam //
analyzed: sukha pradam syāt kali kalmaṣa ghnam su śṛṇvatām saṃpaṭhatām praśasyam
translated: Which bestows happiness and destroys the sins of the Kali age, And is praiseworthy for those who listen and recite it well.

original: etattu hṛdayaṃ stotraṃ paṭhedyastu samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: etat tu hṛdayam stotram paṭhet yaḥ tu samāhitaḥ
translated: One who recites this heart-hymn with single-pointed concentration,

original: bhavet tasyeṣṭadā devī prasannā bhuvaneśvarī // //
analyzed: bhavet tasya iṣṭa dā devī prasannā bhuvaneśvarī
translated: To him, the goddess, the satisfied Mistress of the Universe, will grant his desires.

original: dadāti dhanamāyuṣyaṃ puṇyaṃ puṇyamatiṃ tathā /
analyzed: dadāti dhanam āyuṣyam puṇyam puṇya matim tathā
translated: She grants wealth, longevity, merit, and a meritorious mind,

original: naiṣṭhikīṃ devabhaktiṃ ca gurubhaktiṃ viśeṣataḥ // //
analyzed: naiṣṭhikīm deva bhaktim ca guru bhaktim viśeṣataḥ
translated: And unwavering devotion to the gods, especially to the guru.

original: pūrṇimāyāṃ caturddaśyāṃ kujavāre viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: pūrṇimāyām caturddaśyām kujavāre viśeṣataḥ
translated: On the full moon day, the fourteenth day, and especially on Tuesdays,

original: paṭhanīyamidaṃ stotraṃ devasadmani yatnataḥ // //
analyzed: paṭhanīyam idam stotram deva sadmani yatnataḥ
translated: This hymn should be recited with effort in the temple of the gods.

original: yatra kutrāpi pāṭhena stotrasyāsya phalaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yatra kutra api pāṭhena stotrasya asya phalam bhavet
translated: Wherever this hymn is recited, its fruits will be obtained.

original: sarvasthāneṣu deveśyāḥ pūtadehaḥ sadā paṭhet // //
analyzed: sarva sthāneṣu deveśyāḥ pūta dehaḥ sadā paṭhet
translated: In all places, one with a purified body should always recite this.

original: iti nīlasarasvatītantre bhuvaneśvarīpaṭale śrīdevīśvarasaṃvāde
analyzed: iti nīlasarasvatītantre bhuvaneśvarī paṭale śrī devīśvara saṃvāde
translated: Thus, in the Nīla-sarasvatī-tantra, in the chapter on Bhuvaneśvarī, in the dialogue between Śrī Devī and Śiva,

original: śrībhuvaneśvarīhṛdayastotraṃ samāptam //
analyzed: śrī bhuvaneśvarī hṛdaya stotram samāptam
translated: The heart-hymn of Śrī Bhuvaneśvarī is complete.

original: atha śrībhuvaneśvarīstotram🔽athānandamayīṃ sākṣācchabdabrahmasvarūpiṇīm /
analyzed: atha śrī bhuvaneśvarī stotram  atha ānanda mayīm sākṣāt śabda brahma svarūpiṇīm
translated: Now, the hymn to Śrī Bhuvaneśvarī.

original: īḍe sakalasampatyai jagatkāraṇamambikām // //
analyzed: īḍe sakala sampatyai jagat kāraṇam ambikām
translated: Now, I praise Ambikā, the cause of the universe, who is full of bliss and is the very form of the Brahman of sound, for the sake of all accomplishments.

original: ādyāmaśeṣajananīmaravindayonerviṣṇoḥ śivasya ca vapuḥpratipādayitrīm /🔽sṛṣṭisthitikṣayakarīṃ jagatāṃ trayāṇāṃ stutvā giraṃ vimalayāmyahamambike /
analyzed: ādyām aśeṣa jananīm aravindayoneḥ viṣṇoḥ śivasya ca vapuḥ pratipādayitrīm  sṛṣṭi sthiti kṣaya karīm jagatām trayāṇām stutvā giram vimalayāmi aham ambike
translated: I praise the primordial mother of all, who is the bestower of the forms of Vishnu, Shiva, and the lotus-born Brahma,

original: tvām // //🔽pṛthvyā jalena śikhinā marutāṃ vareṇa hotrendunā dinakareṇa ca mūrtibhājaḥ /
analyzed: tvām  pṛthvyāḥ jalena śikhinā marutām vareṇa hotrā indunā dinakareṇa ca mūrti bhājaḥ
translated: The cause of creation, sustenance, and destruction of the three worlds, O Ambika, I praise you with pure words.🔽You are the cause of the power of the god Shiva, the enemy of Kama, O daughter of the king of mountains.

original: devasya manmathariporapiśaktimattāhetustvameva khalu parvatarājaputri / // //
analyzed: devasya manmatha ripoḥ api śaktimat tā hetuḥ tvam eva khalu parvatarāja putri
translated: The earth, water, fire, wind, sun, moon, and the oblation - these are the forms of Shiva.

original: trisrotasaḥ sakaladevasamarccitāyā vaiśiṣṭyakāraṇamavaimi tadeva mātaḥ /
analyzed: trisrotasaḥ sakala deva samarccitāyāḥ vaiśiṣṭya kāraṇam avaimi tat eva mātar
translated: O mother of three streams, worshipped by all gods, I know that to be the cause of your superiority,

original: tvatpādapaṅkajaparāgapavitritāsu śambhorjaṭāsu satataṃ parivartanaṃ yat // //
analyzed: tvad pāda paṅkaja parāga pavitritāsu śambhoḥ jaṭāsu satatam parivartanam yat
translated: That Shiva's matted locks are always turned towards your lotus feet, sanctified by the pollen of your feet.

original: ānandayet kumudinīmadhipaḥ kalānāṃ nānyāminaḥ kamalinīmatha netarāṃ vā /
analyzed: ānandayet kumudinīm adhipaḥ kalānām na anya āminaḥ kamalinīm atha na itarām vā
translated: The lord of the lilies delights in the moon, not in the lotus, nor in anything else.

original: ekatra modanavidhau parame ka īṣṭe tvantu prapañcamabhinandayasi svadṛṣṭyā //
analyzed: ekatra modana vidhau parame kaḥ īṣṭe tvam tu prapañcam abhinandayasi sva dṛṣṭyā
translated: Who would desire to delight in one thing when there is a supreme method of delighting in all? But you delight in the world with your own vision.

original: ādyā'pyaśeṣajagatāṃ navayauvanā'si śailādhirājatanayā'pyatikomalā'si /
analyzed: ādyā api aśeṣa jagatām nava yauvanā asi śaila adhirāja tanayā api ati komalā asi
translated: Though you are the primordial one of all beings, you are youthful, though you are the daughter of the king of mountains, you are extremely delicate.

original: trayyāḥprasūrapi tathā na samīkṣitā'si dhyeyā'si gauri / manaso na pathi sthitā'si // //
analyzed: trayyāḥ prasūḥ api tathā na samīkṣitā asi dhyeyā asi gauri manasaḥ na pathi sthitā asi  /
translated: O Gauri, you are not even seen by the three Vedas, you are to be meditated upon, you are not on the path of the mind.

original: āsādya janma manujeṣu cirāddurāpaṃ tatrāpi pāṭavamavāpya nijendriyāṇām /
analyzed: āsādya janma manujeṣu cirāt durāpam tatra api pāṭavam avāpya nija indriyāṇām
translated: Having obtained birth among humans after a long time, difficult to attain, and having attained skill in one's own senses,

original: nābhyarcayanti jagatāṃ janayitri / ye tvāṃ niḥśreṇikāgramadhiruhya punaḥ patanti
analyzed: na abhyarcayanti jagatām janayitri ye tvām niḥśreṇika agram adhiruhya punar patanti
translated: Those who do not worship you, O mother of the worlds, having ascended the topmost step, fall again.

original: karpūracūrṇahimavāriviloḍitena ye candanena kusumaiśca sugandhigandhaiḥ /🔽ārādhayanti hi bhavāni / samutsukāstvāṃ te khalvaśeṣabhuvanādhibhuvaḥ
analyzed: karpūra cūrṇa hima vāri viloḍitena ye candanena kusumaiḥ ca sugandhi gandhaiḥ  ārādhayanti hi bhavāni samutsukāḥ tvām te khalu aśeṣa bhuvana adhibhuvaḥ
translated: Those who worship you, O Bhavानी, with sandal paste churned with snow and water, with fragrant flowers and sweet-smelling scents,

original: prathante // //
analyzed: prathante
translated: They indeed become the lords of all the worlds.

original: āviśya madhyapadavīṃ prathame saroje suptāhirājasadṛśī viracayya viśvam /
analyzed: āviśya madhya padavīm prathame saroje supta ahirāja sadṛśī viracayya viśvam
translated: Having entered the middle path, like a sleeping serpent king on the first lotus, creating the universe,

original: vidyullatāvalayavibhramamudvahantī padmāni pañca vidalayya samaśnuvānā // //
analyzed: vidyut latā valaya vibhramam udvahantī padmāni pañca vidalayya samaśnuvānā
translated: Bearing the charm of a circle of lightning flashes, having split the five lotuses, enjoying.

original: tannirgatāmṛtarasaiḥ pariṣiktagātramārgeṇa tena nilayaṃ punarapyavāptā /
analyzed: tad nirgata amṛta rasaiḥ pariṣikta gātra mārgeṇa tena nilayam punar api avāptā
translated: Whose body is sprinkled with the nectar flowing from that, having again reached the abode by that path,

original: yeṣāṃ hṛdi sphurasi jātu na te bhaveyurmātarmaheśvarakuṭumbini /
analyzed: yeṣām hṛdi sphurasi jātu na te bhaveyuḥ mātar maheśvara kuṭumbini
translated: Those in whose heart you do not dwell, O mother of Maheśvara's family, they would never become

original: garbhabhājaḥ // //
analyzed: garbha bhājaḥ
translated: Embraced by you.

original: ālambikuṇḍalabharāmabhirāmavaktrāmāpīvarastanataṭīṃ tanuvṛttamadhyām /
analyzed: ālambi kuṇḍala bharām abhirāma vaktrām āpīvara stana taṭīm tanu vṛtta madhyām
translated: I meditate on your form, O Gouri, with a face charming like a pendant earring, with full and firm breasts, with a slender and round waist,

original: cintākṣasūtrakalaśālikhitāḍhyahastāmāvartayāmi manasā tava gauri / mūrtim //
analyzed: cintā akṣasūtra kalaśa ālikhita āḍhya hastām āvartayāmi manasā tava gauri mūrtim
translated: with hands adorned with a rosary, a water pot, and a book, O Gouri, I meditate on your form in my mind.

original: āsthāya yogamavajitya ca vairiṣaṭkamābaddhya cendriyagaṇaṃ manasi prasanne /
analyzed: āsthāya yogam avajitya ca vairi ṣaṭkam ābaddhya ca indriya gaṇam manasi prasanne
translated: Having attained yoga and conquered the group of six enemies, having bound the group of senses, with the mind pleased,

original: pāśāṅkuśābhayavarāḍhyakarāṃ suvaktrāmālokayanti bhuvaneśvari /
analyzed: pāśa aṅkuśa abhaya vara āḍhya karām su vaktrām ālokayanti bhuvaneśvari
translated: the yogis look at you, O Goddess of the world, with a beautiful face, with hands holding a noose, a goad, a boon, and a gesture of protection.

original: yoginastvām // //
analyzed: yoginaḥ tvām
translated: The yogis look at you, O Goddess of the world.

original: uttaptahāṭakanibhākaribhiścaturbhirāvartitāmṛtaghaṭairabhiṣicyamānā /🔽hastadvayena naline rucire vahantī padmā'pi sā'bhayavarā bhavasi tvameva // //
analyzed: uttapta hāṭaka nibhā karibhiḥ caturbhiḥ āvartita amṛta ghaṭaiḥ abhiṣicyamānā  hasta dvayena naline rucire vahantī padmā api sa abhaya varā bhavasi tvam eva
translated: You who are being sprinkled with four golden pitchers filled with nectar,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: holding a lotus in your two hands, you are the same as the lotus, with a boon and a gesture of protection.

original: aṣṭābhirugravividhāyudhavāhinībhirdorvallarībhiradhiruhya mṛgādhirājam /
analyzed: aṣṭābhiḥ ugra vividha āyudha vāhinībhiḥ dos vallarībhiḥ adhiruhya mṛgādhirājam
translated: Riding on the king of beasts, with eight powerful and various weapons, with armlets,

original: dūrvādaladyutiramartyavipakṣapakṣān nyakkurvatī tvamasi devi / bhavāni / durgā //
analyzed: dūrvā dala dyutiḥ amartya vipakṣa pakṣāt nyakkurvatī tvam asi devi bhavāni durgā
translated: making the wings of the immortal enemies pale, O Goddess, you are Durga.

original: āvirnidāghajalaśīkaraśobhivaktrāṃ guñjāphalena parikalpitahārayaṣṭim /
analyzed: āvis nidāgha jala śīkara śobhi vaktrām guñjā phalena parikalpita hāra yaṣṭim
translated: With a face shining like the water drops in the summer rain, with a necklace made of a gunja fruit,

original: pītāṃśukāmasitakāntimanaṅgatandrāmādyāṃ pulindataruṇīmasakṛt smarāmi
analyzed: pīta aṃśukām asita kāntim anaṅga tandrām ādyām pulinda taruṇīm asakṛt smarāmi
translated: I constantly remember the young Pulinda woman, whose yellow garment and dark complexion are free from the languor of passion,

original: haṃsairgatikvaṇitanūpuradūradṛṣṭe mūrtairivārthavacanairanugamyamānau /
analyzed: haṃsaiḥ gati kvaṇita nūpura dūra dṛṣṭe mūrtaiḥ iva artha vacanaiḥ anugamyamānau
translated: Followed by the swans, which are seen far away by the jingling of her anklets, as if by embodied meaningful words,

original: padmāvivordhvamukharūḍhasujātanālau śrīkaṇṭhapatni / śirasā vidadhe
analyzed: padmau iva ūrdhva mukha rūḍha sujāta nālau śrīkaṇṭha patni śirasā vidadhe
translated: Like two lotuses with well-grown stalks rising upwards, O Śrīkaṇṭha's consort,

original: tavāṅghrī // //
analyzed: tava aṅghrī
translated: I place your feet on my head.

original: dvābhyāṃ samīkṣitumatṛptimateva dṛgbhyāmutpāṭya bhālanayanaṃ🔽vṛṣaketanena /
analyzed: dvābhyām samīkṣitum atṛptimatā iva dṛgbhyām utpāṭya bhāla nayanam  vṛṣaketanena
translated: As if unable to see enough with two eyes, the bull-bannered one tore out a third eye from his forehead

original: sāndrānurāgataralena nirīkṣyamāṇe jañghe śubhe api bhavāni / tavānato'smi // //
analyzed: sāndra anurāga taralena nirīkṣyamāṇe jañghe śubhe api bhavāni tava ānataḥ asmi  /
translated: And looked at your beautiful thighs, trembling with intense affection. O Bhavānī, I bow to you.

original: ūrū smarāmi jitahastikarāvalepau sthaulyena mārdavatayā paribhūtarambhau /🔽śroṇībharasya sahanau parikalpya dattaustambhāvivāṅga vayasā tava madhyamena
analyzed: ūrū smarāmi jita hasti kara avalepau sthaulyena mārdava tayā paribhūta rambhau  śroṇī bharasya sahanau parikalpya dattau stambhau iva aṅga vayasā tava madhyamena
translated: I remember your thighs, which surpass the trunk of an elephant in thickness and softness,🔽Which seem to have been given as pillars to support the weight of your hips by your youth, O lady with beautiful limbs.

original: śroṇyaustanau ca yugapat prathayiṣyatoccairbālyātpareṇa vayasā parihṛṣṭasārau
analyzed: śroṇyau stanau ca yugapad prathayiṣyata uccais bālyāt pareṇa vayasā parihṛṣṭa sārau
translated: Your breasts and hips, which will be displayed together in later youth, with their essence delighted,

original: romāvalīvilasitena vibhāvya mūrtiṃ madhyaṃ tava sphuratu me hṛdayasya madhye
analyzed: roma āvalī vilasitena vibhāvya mūrtim madhyam tava sphuratu me hṛdayasya madhye
translated: May your waist, with its form manifested by the play of the row of hair, shine in the middle of my heart.

original: sakhyaḥ smarasya haranetrahutāśaśāntyai lāvaṇyavāribharitaṃ navayauvanena /
analyzed: sakhyaḥ smarasya hara netra hutāśa śāntyai lāvaṇya vāri bharitam nava yauvanena
translated: O friends, filled with the water of beauty by fresh youth, for the pacification of the fire of Shiva's eye, Cupid

original: āpādya dattamiva pallavamapraviṣṭaṃ nābhiṃ kadāpi tava devi / na vismareyam //🔽īśe'pi gehapiśunaṃ bhasitaṃ dadhāne kāśmīrakarddamamanustanapaṅkaje te /
analyzed: āpādya dattam iva pallavam apraviṣṭam nābhim kadāpi tava devi na vismareyam  īśe pi geha piśunam bhasitam dadhāne kāśmīra karddama manu stana paṅkaje te
translated: O Goddess, I shall never forget the sprout-like feet that you placed on my head, which were not yet fully entered into the navel, as if given by you, the newly youthful one, filled with the water of beauty,🔽for the sake of pacifying the fire of love in Shiva's eye.

original: snātotthitasya kariṇaḥ kṣaṇalakṣyaphenau sindūritau smarayataḥ samadasya🔽kumbhau // //
analyzed: snāta utthitasya kariṇaḥ kṣaṇa lakṣya phenau sindūritau smarayataḥ sa madasya  kumbhau
translated: Even when the Lord, the punisher of the house-dwelling demon, places the ashes on your lotus-like breasts anointed with saffron paste,🔽the two temples of the rutting elephant rising from the bath, reddened with vermilion, remind me of your cheeks.

original: kaṇṭhātiriktagaladujjvalakāntidhārāśobhau bhujau nijaripokarmakaradhvajena /🔽kaṇṭhagrahāya racitau kila dīrghapāśau mātarmama smṛtipathaṃ na
analyzed: kaṇṭha atirikta galat ujjvala kānti dhārā śobhau bhujau nija ripo karma kara dhvajena  kaṇṭha grahāya racitau kila dīrgha pāśau mātar mama smṛti patham na
translated: Your two arms, shining with a stream of brilliant luster flowing beyond the neck,

original: vilaṅghayetām // //
analyzed: vilaṅghayetām  /
translated: as if made into long ropes for embracing the neck by the work-axe of your enemy, O Mother, may they never transgress the path of my memory.

original: nātyāyataṃ racitakambuvilāsacauryaṃ bhūṣābhareṇa vividhena virājamānam /
analyzed: na ati āyatam racita kambu vilāsa cauryam bhūṣā bhareṇa vividhena virājamānam
translated: The neck, which is not too long, charming with the play of conch-shell, shining with various ornaments,

original: kaṇṭhaṃ manoharaguṇaṃ girirājakanye / sañcintya tṛptimupayāmi kadāpi nāham
analyzed: kaṇṭham manohara guṇam girirāja kanye sañcintya tṛptim upayāmi kadāpi na aham
translated: O daughter of the king of mountains, I never attain satisfaction by recollecting that captivating neck.

original: atyāyatākṣamabhijātalalāṭapaṭṭam mandasmitena daraphullakapolarekham /
analyzed: atyāyata akṣam abhijāta lalāṭa paṭṭam manda smitena dara phulla kapola rekham
translated: The forehead broad and long, the cheeks blooming with a faint smile,

original: bimbādharaṃ vadanamunnatadīrghanāsaṃ yaste smaratyasakṛdamba / sa eva jātaḥ //
analyzed: bimba adharam vadanam unnata dīrgha nāsam yaḥ te smarati asakṛt amba saḥ eva jātaḥ
translated: O Mother, he who repeatedly remembers your face with lips like a bimba fruit, a high and long nose, is indeed born.

original: āvistuṣārakaralekhamanalpagandhapuṣpoparibhramadalivrajanirviśeṣam /
analyzed: āvis tuṣāra kara lekham analpa gandha puṣpa upari bhramat ali vraja nirviśeṣam
translated: Which is not different from the flock of bees hovering over the abundant fragrant flowers,

original: yaścetasā kalayate tava keśapāśaṃ tasya svayaṃ galati devi purāṇapāśaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ cetasā kalayate tava keśapāśam tasya svayam galati devi purāṇa pāśaḥ
translated: And who mentally considers your hair braid, O Goddess, the ancient bond of that person naturally falls away.

original: śrutisucaritapākaṃ śrīmatāṃ stotrametat paṭhati ya iha martyo
analyzed: śruti su carita pākam śrīmatām stotram etat paṭhati yaḥ iha martyaḥ
translated: The mortal who recites this hymn of the prosperous ones, which is the ripening of well-performed deeds heard,

original: nityamārdrāntarātmā /🔽sa bhavati padamuccaiḥ sampadāṃ pādanamrakṣitipamukuṭalakṣmīlakṣaṇānāṃ

original: etābhyāṃ namaskṛtya nābhimātre jale sthitvā jalamadhye kaniṣṭhayā trikoṇaṃ
analyzed: etābhyām namaskṛtya nābhi mātre jale sthitvā jala madhye kaniṣṭhayā trikoṇam
translated: Having bowed to these two, standing in water up to the navel, in the middle of the water, with the little finger, one should draw a triangle,

original: ṣaṭkoṇaṃ aṣṭadalaṃ ṣoḍaśadalaṃ caturaśraṃ likhitvā trikoṇamadhye
analyzed: ṣaṣ koṇam aṣṭa dalam ṣoḍaśa dalam catur aśram likhitvā tri koṇa madhye
translated: a hexagon, an eight-petaled lotus, a sixteen-petaled lotus, and a square, and in the middle of the triangle,

original: mūlabījaṃ vilikhya / tīrthaṃsūryamaṇḍalādaṅkuśamudrayā aiṃ hṛdayāya
analyzed: mūlabījam vilikhya tīrtham sūrya maṇḍalāt aṅkuśa mudrayā aim hṛdayāya
translated: having written the root seed, one should draw the sacred place with the hook mudra from the sun mandala, with the mantra Aim, salutations to the heart.

original: nama iti mantreṇākṛṣya tīrthe kṣpitvā tatra tīrthamāvāhayet / mantraḥ
analyzed: namaḥ iti mantreṇa ākṛṣya tīrthe kṣpitvā tatra tīrtham āvāhayet mantraḥ
translated: Having drawn the sacred place with this mantra, one should deposit it in the sacred place and invoke the sacred place there. The mantra is:

original: brahmāṇḍodaratīrthāni karaiḥ spṛṣṭāni te rave /
analyzed: brahmāṇḍa udara tīrthāni karaiḥ spṛṣṭāni te rave
translated: O Sun, the sacred places in the belly of the universe have been touched by your rays.

original: tena satyena me deva / tīrthaṃ dehi divākara /
analyzed: tena satyena me deva tīrtham dehi divākara
translated: By that truth, O God, give me the sacred place, O Sun.

original: gaṅge ca yamune caiva godāvari sarasvati /
analyzed: gaṅge ca yamune ca eva godāvari sarasvati
translated: Ganga and Yamuna, Godavari and Sarasvati,🔽Narmada, Sindhu and Kaveri,

original: narmade sindhu kāveri / jale'smin sannidhiṃ kuru //
analyzed: narmade sindhu kāveri jalesmin sannidhim kuru
translated: make your presence in this water.

analyzed: imam me gaṅge yamune iti
translated: O Ganga, O Yamuna,

original: āvāhayāmi tāṃ devīṃ snānārthamiha sundari /
analyzed: āvāhayāmi tām devīm snāna artham iha sundari
translated: I invoke that goddess here, O beautiful one, for bathing.

original: ehi gaṅge / namastubhyaṃ sarvatīrthasamanvite //
analyzed: ehi gaṅge namaḥ tubhyam sarva tīrtha samanvite
translated: Come, O Ganga, salutations to you, endowed with all the holy places.

original: aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ sarvānandamaye tīrthaśakte ehi ehi svāhā iti
analyzed: aim   śrīṃ sarva ānanda maye tīrtha śakte ehi ehi svāhā iti
translated: With the mantra Aim Hrim Shrim, O Goddess of the power of all blissful holy places, come, come, svaha,

original: mantreṇāṅkuśamudrayā saṃyojyāvāhanādimudrāḥ pradarśya āvāhāni
analyzed: mantreṇa aṅkuśa mudrayā saṃyojya āvāhana ādi mudrāḥ pradarśya
translated: having united with the ankusha mudra, having displayed the mudras of invocation etc., the invocations

original: sthāpanī sannirodhinī avaguṇṭhanī sammukhīkaraṇī dhenuḥ yoniḥ etāḥ
analyzed: sthāpanī sannirodhinī avaguṇṭhanī sammukhīkaraṇī dhenuḥ yoniḥ etāḥ
translated: are established, restrained, covered, faced, the cow, the yoni - these

original: sapta mudrāḥ pradarśya ṣaḍaṅgaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: sapta mudrāḥ pradarśya ṣaḍaṅgam kuryāt
translated: seven mudras should be displayed and the six limbs should be performed.

original: p / 🔽tadyathā oṃ hrāṃ hṛdayāya aṅguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ / hrriṃ śirase🔽svāhā tarjanībhyāṃ namaḥ / hrūṃ śikhāyai vaṣaṭ madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: p  tat yathā om hrāṃ hṛdayāya aṅguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ hrriṃ śirase  svāhā tarjanībhyām namaḥ hrūm śikhāyai vaṣaṭ madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: P.🔽Namely, Om Hram to the heart, salutations with the thumbs. Hrim to the head,🔽Svaha with the index fingers, salutations. Hrum to the tuft, Vashat with the middle fingers, salutations.

original: hraiṃ kavacāya huṃ anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ / hrauṃ netrayāya vauṣaṭ
analyzed: hraiṃ kavacāya hum anāmikābhyām namaḥ   netrayāya vauṣaṭ
translated: Hraim to the armor, Hum with the ring fingers, salutations. Hroum to the eyes, Vaushat with the little fingers, salutations.

original: kaniṣṭhikābhyāṃ namaḥ / hraḥ astrāya phaṭ karatalakarapṛṣṭhābhyāṃ nama
analyzed: kaniṣṭhikābhyām namaḥ   astrāya phaṭ kara tala kara pṛṣṭhābhyām nama
translated: With the little fingers, salutations. Hrah. To the weapon, Phat. To the palm and back of the hand, salutations.

original: itthaṃ ṣaḍaṅgaṃ vidhāya pāṇibhyāmācchādya mūlena saptavāramabhimantrya /
analyzed: ittham ṣaḍaṅgam vidhāya pāṇibhyām ācchādya mūlena sapta vāram abhimantrya
translated: Having thus formed the six-limbed [Vidyā], covering with the two hands, and incanting with the root [mantra] seven times,

original: amṛteśvarīṃ saptaśo japitvā dyātvā'camya snāyāt / tadyathā oṃ hrīṃ
analyzed: amṛteśvarīm saptaśas japitvā dyātvā ācamya snāyāt tat yathā om hrīṃ
translated: Having muttered the seven [mantras] of Amṛteśvarī, having offered oblations, having sipped water, one should bathe. As follows: Om, Hrim.

original: klīṃ āṃ amṛte amṛtodbhave amṛteśvari amṛtavarṣiṇi amṛtaṃ srāvaya
analyzed: klīṃ āṃ amṛte amṛtodbhave amṛteśvari amṛta varṣiṇi amṛtam srāvaya
translated: Klim. Amṛte, you who bring forth nectar, O Amṛteśvarī, you who rain nectar, let nectar flow.

original: srāvaya sāṃ jūṃ jūṃ saḥ amṛteśvaryai svāhā /
analyzed: srāvaya sām jūm jūm saḥ amṛteśvaryai svāhā
translated: Let it flow. Sām. Jūm. Jūm. Sah. To Amṛteśvarī, Svāhā.

original: prasṛtāmṛtaraśmyaughasantarpitacarācaram /
analyzed: prasṛta amṛta raśmi augha santarpita carācaram
translated: The moving and unmoving [world] is satisfied by the stream of nectar rays that flow forth.

original: bhavāni / bhavaśāntyai tvāṃ bhāvayāmyamṛteśvarīm //
analyzed: bhavāni bhava śāntyai tvām bhāvayāmi amṛta īśvarīm
translated: O Bhairavī, for the peace of existence, I contemplate you, the nectar-goddess.

original: antaḥśaktimabhidhyāyannādhārād brahmarandhragām /
analyzed: antar śaktim abhidhyāyan ādhārāt brahmarandhra gām
translated: Contemplating the inner power that moves from the base to the aperture of Brahmā,

original: tasyāḥ pīyūṣavarṣeṇa snānamantaḥ samācaret //
analyzed: tasyāḥ pīyūṣa varṣeṇa snānam antar samācaret
translated: One should perform the inner bathing with the rain of nectar from that.

original: ityuktarītyā dhyātvā nimajyonmajya mūlena saptavāraṃ mārjanaṃ kṛtvā tataḥ
analyzed: iti ukta rītyā dhyātvā nimajya unmajya mūlena sapta vāram mārjanam kṛtvā tatas
translated: Having contemplated in the manner described, having submerged and emerged, having wiped with the root [mantra] seven times, then

original: aghamarṣaṇaṃ kuryāt / tadyathā dakṣiṇapāṇitale jalaṃ gṛhītvā mūlena
analyzed: aghamarṣaṇam kuryāt tat yathā dakṣiṇa pāṇi tale jalam gṛhītvā mūlena
translated: One should perform the Aghamarṣaṇa [rite]. As follows: Having taken water in the right palm, with the root [mantra]

original: saptavāramabhimantritaṃ cidrūpaṃ smṛtvā vāmapāṇinā saṃghaṭṭamudrayā
analyzed: sapta vāram abhimantritam cit rūpam smṛtvā vāma pāṇinā saṃghaṭṭa mudrayā
translated: Having visualized the water in the form of consciousness, enchanted seven times, with the left hand in the saṃghaṭṭa mudrā,

original: mūlavidyayā trivāraṃ mūrdhni abhiṣiñcyāvaśiṣṭamudaka miḍayā saṃgṛhya
analyzed: mūlavidyayā tri vāram mūrdhni abhiṣiñcya avaśiṣṭam udakam iḍayā saṃgṛhya
translated: one should sprinkle the head three times with the root mantra, collect the remaining water with the iḍā,

original: antarnāḍīṃ prakṣālya kaluṣaṃ kajjalābhaṃ piṅgalayā virecya vāme vajraśilāṃ
analyzed: antar nāḍīm prakṣālya kaluṣam kajjala ābham piṅgalayā virecya vāme vajra śilām
translated: wash the inner nāḍī, and expel the impurities, which are like black collyrium, with the piṅgalā, having visualized the vajra-stone in the left,

original: dhyātvā huṃ phaṭ iti mantreṇa vāmabhāgasthavajraśilāyāmāskālayet / tato
analyzed: dhyātvā hum phaṭ iti mantreṇa vāma bhāga stha vajra śilāyām āskālayet
translated: one should place it on the vajra-stone in the left part with the mantra huṃ phaṭ. Then,

original: yonimudrayā śirasi mūlena trivāramabhiṣiñcya hṛdi bāhvostrirabhiṣiñcayet /
analyzed: yonimudrayā śirasi mūlena tri vāram abhiṣiñcya hṛdi bāhvoḥ tris abhiṣiñcayet
translated: having sprinkled the head three times with the root mantra in the yoni mudrā, one should sprinkle the heart and arms three times.

original: tato yonimudrayā śirasi mūlena trivāramabhiṣiñcya hṛdi vāhvostrirabhiṣiñcayet
analyzed: tatas yonimudrayā śirasi mūlena tri vāram abhiṣiñcya hṛdi vāhvoḥ tris abhiṣiñcayet
translated: Then, having sprinkled the head three times with the root mantra in the yoni mudrā, one should sprinkle the heart and arms three times.

original: tato jalatarpaṇam / tān devāṃstarpayāmīti jalatarpaṇaṃ kṛtvā / oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ🔽śrīṃ bhuvaneśvaryambāśrīpādukāṃ tarpayāmīti triḥ santarpya bahirnirgacchet /
analyzed: tatas jala tarpaṇam tān devān tarpayāmi iti jala tarpaṇam kṛtvā om aim    śrīṃ bhuvaneśvarī ambā śrī pādukām tarpayāmi iti tris santarpya bahis nirgacchet
translated: Then, the water offering. Having made the water offering with I offer water to those gods, having offered water three times with Oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ🔽śrīṃ I offer water to the venerable Pādukā of Ambā, the goddess of the universe, one should go outside.

original: mūlena dhaute anāhatavāsasī saṃprokṣite paridhāyācamya vibhūtidhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: mūlena dhaute anāhata vāsasī saṃprokṣite paridhāya ācamya vibhūti dhāraṇam
translated: Having put on the washed upper and lower garments with the root mantra, having sipped water, one should perform the application of vibhūti.

original: kuryāt / tadyathā
analyzed: kuryāt tat yathā
translated: That is as follows:

original: prakṣālya pāṇicaraṇāvācamenmūlavidyayā /
analyzed: prakṣālya pāṇi caraṇau ācamet mūlavidyayā
translated: Having washed the hands and feet, one should recite the basic mantra.

original: upavītottarīyāṇi navāni vimalāni ca //
analyzed: upavīta uttarīyāṇi navāni vimalāni ca
translated: The sacred thread and upper garment should be new and clean.

original: bhasmasnānaṃ purā kṛtvā tripuṇdraṃ dhārayet tataḥ /
analyzed: bhasma snānam purā kṛtvā tripuṇdram dhārayet tatas
translated: Having first bathed with ash, one should then apply the Tripuṇḍra mark.

original: tataḥ samyak kuśāsīno kuryāduddhūlanaṃ kramāt //
analyzed: tatas samyak kuryāt uddhūlanam kramāt
translated: Then, sitting properly on kuśa grass, one should gradually apply the ash all over the body.

original: āpādamastakaṃ devi / sitārdranavabhasmanā /
analyzed: āpādamastakam devi sita ārdra nava bhasmanā
translated: From the feet up to the head, O Goddess, with fresh wet ash.

original: sarvāṅgoddhūlanaṃ kuryāt praṇavena śivena vā //
analyzed: sarva aṅga uddhūlanam kuryāt praṇavena śivena vā
translated: One should apply ash all over the body, with the Praṇava or with Śiva.

original: tatastripuṇḍraṃ racayet triyāyuṣasamāhvayam //
analyzed: tatas tripuṇḍram racayet triyāyuṣa samāhvayam
translated: Then one should make the Tripuṇḍra mark, called Triyāyus.

original: tadyathā vibhūtiṃ vāmahaste nidhāya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā pidhāya jātavedase
analyzed: tat yathā vibhūtim vāma haste nidhāya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā pidhāya jātavedase
translated: To do that, one should place the ash in the left hand and cover it with the right hand, and recite the following mantra: Jātavedase

original: oṃ jātavedase sunavāma somamarātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ /
analyzed: om jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyataḥ ni dahāti vedaḥ
translated: Let us press the Soma for Jātavedas. The Veda burns away the enemy.

original: sa naḥ parṣadati durggāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritātyagniḥ // ṛgvedaḥ ///🔽p /
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣadati durggāṇi viśvā nāvā iva sindhum duritā ati agniḥ  ṛgvedaḥ  p
translated: May Agni carry us across all difficulties, like a boat across the river. This is from the Ṛg Veda.

original: gāyatryā oṃ bhūrbhuvaḥ svaḥ / tatsaviturvareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: gāyatryā om bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: The Gāyatrī mantra is: Om bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ. That excellent light of the god Savitr,🔽we meditate upon.🔽May he inspire our minds.

original: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt / tryambakaṃ oṃ tryambakaṃ yajāmahe
analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt tryambakam om tryambakam yajāmahe
translated: The Tryambaka mantra is: Om Tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivartdhanam.

original: sugandhiṃ puṣṭivarddhanam / urvvārukamiva bandhanān mṛtyormukṣīya
analyzed: sugandhim puṣṭi varddhanam urvvārukam iva bandhanāt mṛtyoḥ mukṣīya
translated: fragrant, promoting nourishment. Like a plant from its bonds, be freed from death

original: māmṛtāt // / / agnirasmi oṃ agnirasmi janmanā jātavedā
analyzed: mā amṛtāt        agniḥ asmi om agniḥ asmi janmanā jātavedāḥ
translated: from the immortal. I am Agni, Oṃ. I am Agni, born of birth, all-knowing.

original: ghṛtamme cakṣuramṛtamma'āsan / arkastridhātū rajaso vvimāno'jasro
analyzed: cakṣuḥ amṛtamme āsan arkaḥ tri dhātuḥ rajasaḥ vvimāna ujasraḥ
translated: Ghee is my eye, nectar is my food. The sun, threefold in nature, the measurer of space, the eternal

original: dharmo havirasmi nāma / / / mā na stoke oṃ mā nastoke tanaye mā
analyzed: dharmaḥ haviḥ asmi nāma      mā naḥ stoke om mā naḥ stoke tanaye mā
translated: Dharma, I am the oblation, my name. Do not afflict us, O Rudra, in our children, Oṃ. Do not afflict us in our children, in our life,

original: na āyuṣi mā no goṣu mā no aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ / mā no vīrān rudra bhāmino
analyzed: naḥ āyuṣi mā naḥ goṣu mā naḥ aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ mā naḥ vīrān rudra bhāmino
translated: in our cows, in our horses. Do not slay our heroes, O Rudra, who are devoted to you.

original: vvadhīrhaviṣmantaḥ sadamittvā havāmahe / / / tryāyuṣamjamadagne
analyzed: vvadhīḥ haviṣmantaḥ sadam id tvā havāmahe       tri āyuṣam jamadagne
translated: We always invoke you with oblations. The three-lived one of Jamadagni,

original: oṃ tryāyuṣaṃ jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tryāyuṣam / yad devaṣu tryāyuṣam /
analyzed: om tri āyuṣam jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tri āyuṣam yat deveṣu tri āyuṣam
translated: Oṃ. The three-lived one of Jamadagni, the three-lived one of Kaśyapa, whatever three-lived one there is among the gods,

original: tanno astu tryāyuṣam / riti ṣaṭ agniriti bhasma vāyuriti bhasma jalamiti bhasma
analyzed: tat naḥ astu tri āyuṣam
translated: may that be our three-lived one. Six times Agni, ashes, Vāyu, ashes, Jala, ashes,

original: sthalamiti bhasma vyometi sarvaṃ ha vā idaṃ bhasma / mana etāni cakṣūṃṣi
analyzed: sthalam iti bhasma vyoma iti sarvam ha vai idam bhasma manaḥ etāni cakṣūṃṣi
translated: Sthala, ashes, Vyoma, all this is indeed ashes. The mind is these eyes,

original: bhasmāni bhavanti / tato mūlavidyayā saptavāramabhimantrya / īśāna iti oṃ
analyzed: bhasmāni bhavanti tatas mūlavidyayā sapta vāram abhimantrya īśānaḥ iti om
translated: they become ashes. Then, having enchanted with the root mantra seven times, Īśāna, Oṃ.

original: īśānaḥ sarvavidyānāmīśvaraḥ sarvabhūtānām /
analyzed: īśānaḥ sarva vidyānām īśvaraḥ sarva bhūtānām
translated: The lord of all knowledge, the lord of all beings,

original: brahmādhipatirbrahmaṇo'dhipatirbrahmā śivo me astu sadā śivom // // /
analyzed: brahmā adhipatiḥ brahmaṇaḥ adhipatiḥ brahmā śivaḥ me astu sadā śiva ūm
translated: the overlord of Brahma, the Brahma, may he be auspicious to me always, the auspicious one.

original: śirasi bhasma nidhāya tatpuruṣāye oṃ tatpuruṣāya vidmahe / mahādevāya
analyzed: śirasi bhasma nidhāya tatpuruṣāya om tatpuruṣāya vidmahe mahādevāya
translated: Having applied ash on the head, to Tatpurusha Om, we know Tatpurusha. To Mahadeva

original: dhīmahi / tanno rudraḥ pracodayāt // / / ti vaktre aghorebhya oṃ
analyzed: dhīmahi tat naḥ rudraḥ pracodayāt       ti vaktre aghorebhyaḥ om
translated: we meditate. May Rudra inspire us.🔽To the terrible ones Om, to the terrible ones, and to the more terrible than terrible,

original: aghorebhyo'tha ghorebhyo ghoraghoratarebhyaḥ / sarvebhyaḥ sarva śarvebhyo namaste🔽astu rudrarūpebhyaḥ // / / iti hṛdaye vāmadevāye oṃ vāmadevāya
analyzed: aghorebhyaḥ atha ghorebhyaḥ ghora ghoratarebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ sarva śarvebhyaḥ namaḥ te  astu rudra rūpebhyaḥ      iti hṛdaye vāmadevāye om vāmadevāya
translated: to all, to all the Sharvas, may you be🔽salutations, to the forms of Rudra.

original: namo jyeṣṭhāya namaḥ śreṣṭhāya namo rudrāya namaḥ kālāya namaḥ
analyzed: namaḥ jyeṣṭhāya namaḥ śreṣṭhāya namaḥ rudrāya namaḥ kālāya namaḥ
translated: To Vamadeva Om, salutations to Vamadeva. Salutations to Jyeshtha, salutations to Shreshtha, salutations to Rudra, salutations to Kala, salutations

original: kalavikaraṇāya namo balavikaraṇāya namaḥ // / / ti guhye sadyojāta🔽oṃ sadyojātaṃ prapadyāmi sadyojātāya vai namo namaḥ / bhave bhave nāti
analyzed: kala vikaraṇāya namaḥ bala vikaraṇāya namaḥ       ti guhye sadyojāta  om sadyojātam prapadyāmi sadyojātāya vai namaḥ namaḥ bhave bhave na ati
translated: to Kalavikaranaya, salutations to Balavikaranaya.🔽To the secret part, to Sadyojata Om, I take refuge in Sadyojata, salutations to Sadyojata. Salutations to Bhava, O Bhava, do not

original: bhave bhavasvamāṃ bhavodbhavāya namaḥ // / / miti pādayoḥ / punaḥ
analyzed: bhave bhavasva amām bhavodbhavāya namaḥ                           iti pādayoḥ punar
translated: trouble me. Salutations to the origin of Bhava.🔽To the feet. Again

original: mūlavidyayā śirasi bhasma nidhāya mūlena mukhe mūlena vakṣasi mūlena ūrvoḥ
analyzed: mūlavidyayā śirasi bhasma nidhāya mūlena mukhe mūlena vakṣasi mūlena ūrvoḥ
translated: Having applied ash on the head with the root mantra, on the face with the root mantra, on the chest with the root mantra, on the thighs with the root mantra,

original: mūlena jaṅghayoḥ mūlena pādayoḥ mūlena sarvasandhipradeśeṣu snāyāt /🔽aṅguṣṭhena sammardya kaniṣṭhikayā trikoṇaṃ vilikhya tanmadhye
analyzed: mūlena jaṅghayoḥ mūlena pādayoḥ mūlena sarva sandhi pradeśeṣu snāyāt  aṅguṣṭhena sammardya kaniṣṭhikayā trikoṇam vilikhya tad madhye
translated: on the calves with the root mantra, on the feet with the root mantra, one should bathe with the root mantra on all the joint areas.🔽Having rubbed with the thumb, one should draw a triangle with the little finger, and having written the seed of Bhuvaneśvarī in the middle of that,

original: bhuvaneśvarībījaṃ likhitvā mūlamantreṇa saptavāramabhimantrya aṅguṣṭhena

translated: The sage of the earth is Merupṛṣṭha, the deity is Kūrma, the meter is Sutala, and the application is in the prayer to the earth.

original: pṛthvi / tvayā dhṛtā lokā devi / tvaṃ viṣṇunā dhṛtā /
analyzed: pṛthvi tvayā dhṛtāḥ lokāḥ devi tvam viṣṇunā dhṛtā
translated: O Earth! You are held by the worlds, O Goddess! You are held by Vishnu.

original: tvaṃ ca dhāraya māṃ devi / pavitraṃ kuru cāsanam //
analyzed: tvam ca dhāraya mām devi pavitram kuru ca āsanam
translated: And you hold me, O Goddess! Make the seat pure.🔽O Earth! You are held by the worlds, O Goddess! You are held by Vishnu.🔽And you hold me, O Goddess! Make the seat pure.

original: iti svaśirasi mṛgīmudrayā mātṛkābjaṃ dhyātvā dīpanāthaṃ prapūjayet /
analyzed: iti sva śirasi mṛgī mudrayā mātṛkā abjam dhyātvā dīpanātham prapūjayet
translated: Thus, having visualized the lotus of the Mātṛkās on one's own head with the Mṛgī mudrā, one should worship Dīpanātha.

original: tadyathā
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Namely,

original: kṣetrādyakṣaramuccārya amukakṣetre medātmakakhaḍgīśāya
analyzed: kṣetra ādi akṣaram uccārya amuka kṣetre medā ātmaka khaḍgīśāya
translated: having uttered the first syllable of the field, For me in such-and-such a field, to the essence of fat, to the lord of the sword,

original: varṇeśānandanāthāya atiraktavarṇāya raktadvādaśaśaktiyuktāya asmin kṣetre
analyzed: varṇeśa ānandanāthāya ati rakta varṇāya rakta dvādaśa śakti yuktāya asmin kṣetre
translated: To the lord of the essence of letters, to the lord of bliss, to the one of extremely red color, to the one endowed with twelve red powers, in this field,

original: imāṃ pūjāṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa svāhā iti
analyzed: imām pūjām gṛhṇa gṛhṇa svāhā iti
translated: Accept this worship, accept, svāhā.

original: puṣpākṣatādibhirdīpanāthamabhyarcya
analyzed: puṣpa akṣata ādibhiḥ dīpanātham abhyarcya
translated: Having worshipped Dīpanātha with flowers, unbroken rice, and so on,

original: tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭraṃ / mahākāyakalpāntajvalanopama /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭram mahā kāya kalpānta jvalana upama
translated: Having sharp fangs, having a huge body, resembling the fire at the end of the kalpa,

original: bhairavāya namastubhyamanujñāṃ dātumarhasi //
analyzed: bhairavāya namaḥ tubhyam anujñām dātum arhasi
translated: Salutations to you, Bhairava, you are worthy of granting permission.

original: iti bhairavājñāṃ labdhvā hastābhyāmañjaliṃ vidhāya sapuṣpaṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ🔽śivādigurubhyo namaḥ śirasi gaṃ gaṇapataye namo dakṣaskandhe vaṃ
analyzed: iti bhairava ājñām labdhvā hastābhyām añjalim vidhāya sa puṣpam aim hrīṃ śrīṃ  śiva ādi gurubhyaḥ namaḥ śirasi gaṃ gaṇapataye namaḥ dakṣa skandhe vaṃ
translated: Having obtained Bhairava's command in this way, having made the añjali gesture with both hands along with flowers, Aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ,

original: vaṭukāya namo vāmaskandhe duṃ durgāyai namaḥ dakṣorumūle kṣaṃ
analyzed: vaṭukāya namaḥ vāma skandhe duṃ durgāyai namaḥ dakṣa ūru mūle kṣaṃ
translated: Salutations to the Śiva lineage gurus on the head, salutations to Gaṇapati on the right shoulder, salutations to Vaṭuka on the left shoulder, salutations to Durgā at the base of the right thigh,

original: kṣetrapālāya namo vāmorumūle iti dakṣavāmapārśvordhvādhobhāgeṣu vinyaset🔽p /
analyzed: kṣetrapālāya namaḥ vāma ūru mūle iti dakṣa vāma pārśva ūrdhva adhas bhāgeṣu vinyaset  p
translated: Salutations to Kṣetrapāla at the base of the left thigh. One should place this on the right, left, upper, and lower parts.

original: akhaṇḍamaṇḍalākāraṃ vyāptaṃ yenaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: akhaṇḍa maṇḍala ākāram vyāptam carācaram
translated: The one by whom the moving and unmoving is pervaded, having the form of an unbroken circle,

original: tatpadaṃ darśitaṃ yena tasmai śrīgurave namaḥ //
analyzed: tad padam darśitam yena tasmai śrī gurave namaḥ
translated: I bow to that glorious Guru who has shown that state.

original: caraṇaṃ pavitraṃ vitataṃ purāṇaṃ yena pūtastarati duṣkṛtāni /
analyzed: caraṇam pavitram vitatam purāṇam yena pūtaḥ tarati duṣkṛtāni
translated: The ancient, extended, pure foot by which one who is purified crosses over evil deeds,

original: tena pavitreṇa śuddhena pūtā atipāpmānamarātiṃ tarema //🔽ityādi vaidikairmantrairgurupādukāmuccārya aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ amukānandanātha
analyzed: tena pavitreṇa śuddhena pūtāḥ ati pāpmānam arātim tarema  ityādi vaidikaiḥ mantraiḥ guru pādukām uccārya aim hrīṃ śrīṃ amuka ānandanātha
translated: By that pure, pure one, may we cross over the enemy, great sin.

original: amukāmbāśaktiyukta śrīpādukāṃ pūjayāmi nama iti sahasrāravinde
analyzed: amuka ambā śakti yukta śrī pādukām pūjayāmi namaḥ iti sahasra aravinde
translated: Thus, having worshipped the lotus of a thousand petals with the Vedic mantras, uttering the Guru's sandals, Aim Hrim Shrim, O Lord of Bliss, O Goddess Amba, endowed with Shakti, I worship the glorious sandals, salutations.

original: śrīgurunāthaṃ sampūjya yonimudrayā praṇamet / tato bhūtotsāraṇaṃ kuryāt
analyzed: śrī guru nātham sampūjya yonimudrayā praṇamet tatas bhūta utsāraṇam kuryāt
translated: Having worshipped the glorious Guru-Lord, one should bow with the Yoni Mudra. Then one should perform the expulsion of spirits.

original: apasarpantu te bhūtā ye bhūtā bhūmisaṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: apasarpantu te bhūtāḥ ye bhūtāḥ bhūmi saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Let the spirits depart who are on the earth.

original: ye bhūtā vighnakartāraste naśyantu śivājñayā //
analyzed: ye bhūtāḥ vighna kartāraḥ te naśyantu śiva ājñayā
translated: By Shiva's command, may those spirits who create obstacles be destroyed.

original: oṃ ślīṃ paśu huṃ phaṭ iti pāśupatāstreṇa nārācamudrayā vighnānutsārya🔽siddhārthākṣatakusumaiḥ pātālabhūnabholīnān vighnān krameṇa
analyzed: om ślīṃ paśu hum phaṭ iti pāśupatāstreṇa nārāca mudrayā vighnān utsārya  siddhārtha akṣata kusumaiḥ vighnān krameṇa
translated: Having expelled the obstacles with the weapon of Pashupati, Om Shlim Pashu Hum Phat, with the Naraacha Mudra,🔽The obstacles of the nether world, earth, and sky, in order, with accomplished, meaningful, unbroken, and unbroken flowers,

original: vāmapārṣṇighātakarāsphoṭasamudañcitavaktrairutsārya uktapāśupatāstreṇa
analyzed: vāma pārṣṇi ghāta kara āsphoṭa samudañcita vaktraiḥ utsāryaḥ ukta pāśupatāstreṇa
translated: Having expelled with the aforementioned weapon of Pashupati, with the left heel striking, the hands clapping, and the face raised up,

original: vāmahastatalaṃ dviddhā maṇibandhāt samārabhya sapṛṣṭhaṃ dakṣapāṇinā
analyzed: vāma hasta talam dviddhā maṇibandhāt samārabhya sa pṛṣṭham dakṣa pāṇinā
translated: The left palm should be doubled, starting from the wrist, with the back [of the left palm] touching the right palm,

original: pramṛjya dakṣiṇaṃ pāṇiṃ sakṛdevoktamārgataḥ anena ṣaṭ karaśodhanaṃ
analyzed: pramṛjya dakṣiṇam pāṇim sakṛt eva ukta mārgataḥ anena ṣaṣ kara śodhanam
translated: and the right palm should be wiped once according to the stated path. Having done this six-fold hand purification,

original: kṛtvā nābherāpādaṃ hṛdo nābhiparyantaṃ śiraso hṛtparyantaṃ
analyzed: kṛtvā nābheḥ āpādam hṛdaḥ nābhi paryantam śirasaḥ hṛd paryantam
translated: from the navel to the feet, from the heart to the navel, from the head to the heart,

original: tenaivāstreṇa vyāpayitvā antastālatrayaṃ bahistālatrayaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: tena eva astreṇa vyāpayitvā antar tāla trayam bahis tāla trayam kṛtvā
translated: having pervaded with that weapon, having made three claps inside and three claps outside,

original: daśadigbandhanaṃ kṛtvā raṃ agniprākārāya namaḥ oṃ sahasrāra huṃ phaṭ
analyzed: daśa digbandhanam kṛtvā raṃ agni prākārāya namaḥ om sahasrāra hum phaṭ
translated: having bound the ten directions, Ram, salutations to the fire-enclosure, Om, to the thousand-petalled one, hum phat,

original: svāhā pūrvoktāstramantrābhyāṃ prākārau kṛtvā triragniveṣṭanaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: svāhā pūrva ukta astra mantrābhyām prākārau kṛtvā tris agniveṣṭanam kṛtvā
translated: having created the enclosures with the previously stated weapon mantras, having made three fire-encirclements,

original: evaṃ rakṣāṃ purā kṛtvā bhūtaśuddhimathācaret / tadyathā🔽praṇavadvādaśāvṛtyā nāḍīśuddhiṃ vidhāya hṛdisthaṃ caitanyaṃ haṃsaḥ iti
analyzed: evam rakṣām purā kṛtvā bhūtaśuddhim atha ācaret tat yathā  praṇava dvādaśa āvṛtyā nāḍī śuddhim vidhāya hṛdistham caitanyam haṃsaḥ iti
translated: having thus made protection first, one should then perform the purification of the elements. To that end,🔽having performed the purification of the channels by repeating the praṇava twelve times, the consciousness located in the heart, with the mantra hamsa,

original: mantreṇa saṃghaṭṭamudrayordhvamunniya dvādaśāntaḥsthite pare tejasi saṃyojya
analyzed: mantreṇa saṃghaṭṭa mudrayā ūrdhvam unniya dvādaśāntaḥsthite pare tejasi saṃyojya
translated: having raised it upwards with the saṃghaṭṭa mudrā to the supreme light located at the end of the twelve, having united it,

original: astreṇa rakṣāṃ kṛtvā bhūtāni śodhayet / asya pārthivamantrasya brahmā
analyzed: astreṇa rakṣām kṛtvā bhūtāni śodhayet asya pārthiva mantrasya brahmā
translated: having made protection with the weapon, one should purify the elements. The mantra of this earth is Brahmā,

original: ṛṣirgāyatrī chandaḥ somo devatā pārthivākhyabhūtaśuddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ somaḥ devatā pārthiva ākhya bhūta śuddhi arthe jape viniyogaḥ
translated: The sage is Gayatri, the meter is Gayatri, the deity is Soma. The application is for the purification of the earth-named element in japa.

original: pādādijānuparyantaṃ pṛthvīsthānam tatra pārthivamaṇḍalaṃ pītavarṇaṃ
analyzed: pāda ādi jānu paryantam pṛthvī sthānam tatra pārthiva maṇḍalam pīta varṇam
translated: From the feet up to the knees is the place of earth. There, the earth-circle is yellow in color,

original: catuṣkoṇaṃ vajralāñchitam brahmadaivatyaṃ tena pañcaguṇā pṛthvī
analyzed: catuṣkoṇam vajra lāñchitam brahma daivatyam tena pañcaguṇā pṛthvī
translated: four-cornered, marked with a thunderbolt, and has Brahma as its deity. By that, the earth has five qualities.

original: ṣaḍudghātaprayogeṇa oṃ laṃ bījena saṃśodhya apsu layaṃ nayet /
analyzed: ṣaṣ udghāta prayogeṇa om laṃ bījena saṃśodhya apsu layam nayet
translated: In the practice of six udghātas, having purified with the seed syllable Om Lam, one should dissolve it in water.

original: vāruṇamantrasya gautamaṛṣirvaruṇo devatā triṣṭup chando
analyzed: vāruṇa mantrasya gautama ṛṣiḥ varuṇaḥ devatā triṣṭubh chandaḥ
translated: The sage of the Varuna mantra is Gautama, the deity is Varuna, the meter is Triṣṭubh,

original: varuṇākhyabhūtaśuddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ / jānvādinābhiparyantaṃ
analyzed: varuṇa ākhya bhūtaśuddhi arthe jape viniyogaḥ jānu ādi nābhi paryantam
translated: the application is for the purification of the element called Varuna in japa. From the knees up to the navel,

original: āpasthānaṃ varuṇamaṇḍalaṃ dhavalaṃ dhanurākāraṃ ubhayoḥ koṭyoḥ
analyzed: āpasthānam varuṇa maṇḍalam dhavalam dhanuḥ ākāram ubhayoḥ koṭyoḥ
translated: the place of water is the Varuna-circle, white in color, shaped like a bow, and marked with a white lotus at both ends.

original: śvetapadmalāñchitaṃ tanmadhye vaṃ bījaṃ śvetavarṇaṃ viṣṇudaivatyaṃ tena🔽caturguṇā āpaḥ pañcodghātaprayogeṇa śoṣayāmi / oṃ vaṃ iti bījena tejasi🔽layaṃ nayet /
analyzed: śveta padma lāñchitam tad madhye vaṃ bījam śveta varṇam viṣṇu daivatyam tena  caturguṇāḥ āpaḥ pañca udghāta prayogeṇa śoṣayāmi om vaṃ iti bījena tejasi  layam nayet
translated: In the middle of that, the seed syllable Vam is white in color, and has Vishnu as its deity. By that,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: the waters have four qualities. With the practice of five udghātas, I dry them. With the seed syllable Om Vam, one should dissolve it in fire.

original: āgneyamaṃtrasya kaśyapaḥ ṛṣiḥ / agnirdevatā triṣṭup chanda
analyzed: āgneya maṃtrasya kaśyapaḥ ṛṣiḥ agniḥ devatā triṣṭubh chandaḥ
translated: The sage of the Agni mantra is Kashyapa, the deity is Agni, the meter is Triṣṭubh,

original: āgneyākhyabhūtaśuddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ / nābhyādihṛdayaparyantaṃ
analyzed: āgneya ākhya bhūtaśuddhi arthe jape viniyogaḥ nābhi ādi hṛdaya paryantam
translated: The application is for the purification of the element called Agni. From the navel up to the heart,

original: agnisthānaṃ tatra vahnimaṇḍalaṃ trikoṇākāraṃ koṇatraye svastikāṅkitaṃ🔽tanmadhye raṃ bījaṃ raktavarṇaṃ rudradaivatyaṃ tena triguṇo vahnistrirud
analyzed: agni sthānam tatra vahni maṇḍalam trikoṇa ākāram koṇa traye svastika aṅkitam  tad madhye raṃ bījam rakta varṇam rudra daivatyam tena triguṇaḥ vahniḥ tris ud
translated: the place of fire. There, the fire circle is triangular in shape, marked with a svastika in the three corners.

original: ghātaprayogeṇa śoṣayāmi / oṃ raṃ iti vāyau layaṃ nayet /
analyzed: ghāta prayogeṇa śoṣayāmi om raṃ iti vāyau layam nayet
translated: In the middle of that, the seed syllable Ram is red in color, and has Rudra as its deity. By that, the fire is threefold. With the application of three exhalations, I dry it up. Om Ram - this should be dissolved in the air.

original: vāyavyamantrasya kiṣkandha ṛṣirvāyurdevatā triṣṭup chando
analyzed: vāyavya mantrasya kiṣkandhaḥ ṛṣiḥ vāyuḥ devatā triṣṭubh chandaḥ
translated: The sage of the Vayu mantra is Kiskandha, the deity is Vayu, the meter is Triṣṭubh.

original: vāyavyākhyabhūtaśuddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ / hṛdayādibhrūmadhyaparyantaṃ
analyzed: vāyavya ākhya bhūtaśuddhi arthe jape viniyogaḥ hṛdaya ādi bhrū madhya paryantam
translated: The application is for the purification of the element called Vayu. From the heart up to the middle of the eyebrows,

original: vāyusthānam tatra vāyumaṇḍalaṃ ṣaṭkoṇākāraṃ ṣaḍbindulāñchitam🔽tanmadhye yaṃ bījaṃ nīlavarṇaṃ saṅkarṣaṇadaivatyaṃ triguṇo
analyzed: vāyu sthānam tatra vāyu maṇḍalam ṣaṣ koṇa ākāram ṣaṣ bindu lāñchitam  tad madhye yam bījam nīla varṇam saṅkarṣaṇa daivatyam
translated: the place of Vayu. There, the air circle is hexagonal in shape, marked with six dots.

original: vāyurdvirudghātaprayogeṇa śoṣayāmi oṃ yaṃ iti ākāśe layaṃ nayet /
analyzed: vāyuḥ dvis udghāta prayogeṇa śoṣayāmi om yaṃ iti ākāśe layam nayet
translated: In the middle of that, the seed syllable Yam is blue in color, and has Saṅkarṣaṇa as its deity. The air is threefold. With the application of two exhalations, I dry it up. Om Yam - this should be dissolved in space.

original: ākāśamantrasya brahmā ṛṣiḥ mahadākāśo devatā triṣṭup chanda
analyzed: ākāśa mantrasya brahmā ṛṣiḥ mahat ākāśaḥ devatā triṣṭubh chandaḥ
translated: The sage of the Ākāśa mantra is Brahmā, the deity is the great space, the meter is Triṣṭubh.

original: ākāśākhyabhūtaśuddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ / bhrūmadhyād
analyzed: ākāśa ākhya bhūtaśuddhi arthe jape viniyogaḥ bhrū madhyāt
translated: The application is for the purification of the element called Ākāśa. From the middle of the eyebrows,

original: brahmarandhaparyantamākāśasthānam tatra nabhomaṇḍalaṃ vartulākāraṃ
analyzed: brahmarandha paryantam ākāśa sthānam tatra nabhaḥ maṇḍalam vartula ākāram
translated: The space element extends up to the brahmarandhra. There, the sphere of space is circular in shape.

original: dhvajalāñchitaṃ tanmadhye haṃ bījaṃ dhūmravarṇam sadāśivadaivatyam
analyzed: dhvaja lāñchitam tad madhye haṃ bījam dhūmra varṇam sadāśiva daivatyam
translated: In its center, the seed syllable HÃM is smoky in color, and is presided over by Sadāśiva.

original: tenaikaguṇa ākāśa ekodghātaprayogeṇa śoṣayāmi oṃ haṃ iti bījena pare śive🔽layaṃ nayet /
analyzed: tena eka guṇaḥ ākāśaḥ eka udghāta prayogeṇa śoṣayāmi om haṃ iti bījena pare śive  layam nayet
translated: By that, the space element is dried up by the application of one exhalation, with the seed syllable OṂ HÃM, and is dissolved in the supreme Śiva.

original: ṣaṣṭisaṃkhyā samārabhya dvādaśa dvādaśa tyajet /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi saṃkhyā samārabhya dvādaśa dvādaśa tyajet
translated: Beginning with the number sixty, twelve should be subtracted twelve times.

original: pṛthivyādīni bhūtāni krameṇa svasvakāraṇe //
analyzed: pṛthivī ādīni bhūtāni krameṇa sva sva kāraṇe
translated: The elements such as earth etc. should be dissolved in their respective causes in order.

original: evaṃ pañcamahābhūtāni pare tatve ekībhūtāni vicintya punarbhūtāni pravilāpayet /
analyzed: evam pañca mahābhūtāni pare tatve ekībhūtāni vicintya punar bhūtāni pravilāpayet
translated: Thus, having contemplated that the five great elements become one in the supreme principle, the elements should be dissolved again.

original: oṃ lhāṃ brahmaṇe pṛthivyadhipataye nivṛttikalātmane huṃ phaṭ svāhā
analyzed: om lhāṃ brahmaṇe pṛthivī adhipataye nivṛtti kalā ātmane hum phaṭ svāhā
translated: OṂ LḤĀM to Brahmā, the lord of earth, the embodiment of Nivṛtti Kalā, HŪM PHAṬ SVĀHĀ.

original: pādādijānuparyantaṃ vyāpya pṛthvīṃ śodhayet / oṃ hrīṃ viṣṇave abdhipataye🔽pratiṣṭhākalātmane huṃ phaṭ svāhā iti jānvādinābhiparyantaṃ vyāpya apaḥ
analyzed: pāda ādi jānu paryantam vyāpya pṛthvīm śodhayet om   viṣṇave abdhipataye  pratiṣṭhā kalā ātmane hum phaṭ svāhā iti jānu ādi nābhi paryantam vyāpya apaḥ
translated: Having pervaded from the feet up to the knees, one should purify the earth. OṂ HRĪM to Viṣṇu, the lord of water,🔽the embodiment of Pratiṣṭhā Kalā, HŪM PHAṬ SVĀHĀ. Having pervaded from the knees up to the navel, one should purify the water. OṂ HRAUM to Agni, the lord of fire,

original: śodhayet / oṃ hraṃ agnaye tejo'dhipataye vidyākalātmane huṃ phaṭ svāhā iti
analyzed: śodhayet om hraṃ agnaye tejaḥ adhipataye vidyākalā ātmane hum phaṭ svāhā iti
translated: the embodiment of Vidyā Kalā, HŪM PHAṬ SVĀHĀ. Having pervaded from the navel up to the throat,

original: nābhyādivakṣaḥparyantaṃ vyāpya agniṃ śodhayet / oṃ hyaiṃ īśvarāya
